subject: Using base32 encoding to generate DNS records
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 971, 'name': 'Daniel Salinas', 'email': 'imsplitbit@gmail.com', 'username': 'imsplitbit'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 5390, 'name': 'Steve Leon', 'username': 'steve-leon', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 8214, 'name': 'Auston McReynolds', 'email': 'amcreynolds@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'amcreynolds'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-06 16:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/dns/test_designate_driver.py', 'trove/dns/designate/driver.py'], 'message': 'Using base32 encoding to generate DNS records

The Designate driver generate record names by
hashing and 64-base encoding the instance ID.
The problem is that 64-base encoding can generate
hyphens and upper/lower case letters. Hyphens are
illegal when it is at the beginning of the name.
Name is also case insensitive. So the best solution
is to use BASE-32 encoding.

Change-Id: Ie98a0a50a609207df041c5f0bc2f622701ee9848
Closes-Bug: #1262789
'}]
commit_message:
Using base32 encoding to generate DNS records

The Designate driver generate record names by
hashing and 64-base encoding the instance ID.
The problem is that 64-base encoding can generate
hyphens and upper/lower case letters. Hyphens are
illegal when it is at the beginning of the name.
Name is also case insensitive. So the best solution
is to use BASE-32 encoding.

Change-Id: Ie98a0a50a609207df041c5f0bc2f622701ee9848
Closes-Bug: #1262789

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-01-10 10:38:35.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql/service.py', 'trove/instance/models.py'], 'message': 'Adds Missing _() for Exception Message Translation

Reasons:
- Exception messages missing underscores. This is necessary to
  mark messages as ready for translation, and is already the
  defacto standard across the trove codebase,as per,
  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations
- Because of incorrect Exception messages, it does not overrides
  the default message of BadRequest.

Changes:
- Adds the missing underscore function to wrap a few user-facing
  exception messages.

Change-Id: Ib4a183f717146493e514b8169679a57cc2ecfd01
Closes-Bug: #1264688
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Missing _() for Exception Message Translation

Reasons:
- Exception messages missing underscores. This is necessary to
  mark messages as ready for translation, and is already the
  defacto standard across the trove codebase,as per,
  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Translations
- Because of incorrect Exception messages, it does not overrides
  the default message of BadRequest.

Changes:
- Adds the missing underscore function to wrap a few user-facing
  exception messages.

Change-Id: Ib4a183f717146493e514b8169679a57cc2ecfd01
Closes-Bug: #1264688

commit_message:
Cleans and improves heat code path

Reasons:
- Heat code path contains cinder code.
- Heat code path contains nova code.
- Heat template is frozen with Volume support,
  it cannot act in a volume disabled environment.

Changes:
- Adds conditional Volume support in heat.template.
- Adds conditional template rendering.
- Cleans nova code from heat code path.
- Cleans cinder code from heat code path.

Change-Id: I7e4d6edf8bb11de0bcf913a58b257c625468322c
Closes-Bug: #1262378

commit_message:
Remove some keystone resource parsers

Current "keystone" command can parse the specified resources(tenant,
user, role, service) by itself. Then it is unnecessary to translate
resource names to resource ids in devstack.

This patch removes these resource parsers from devstack for cleanup.

Change-Id: Ibae06581b471f02168b559b4ca0c10f14996d661

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-01-14 23:04:02.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'swift/obj/mem_server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_sender.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policies.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/request_helpers.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/ssync_receiver.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync_receiver.py'], 'message': 'Storage Policy / DiskFile Interface Support

The EC branch currently has minimal DiskFile support (one API) and
a big todo item for the rest.  This patch completes the support as
well as addresses a change to the one existing interface where we
used to pass the object directory name into DiskFile but have now
decided to pass in the policy index instead and let DiskFile build
the object directory name.  This patch includes:

- change interface param from directory name to policy index
- replace DiskFile DATADIR with Diskfile module method to
  return object directory name based on index (in all

- do the same for ASYNCDIR, although not required, might

  in per policy directories

The patch also includes 2 updates unrelated to diskfile that were
suggested during review:
1) avoid use of extra parm in obj server HTTP verb handlers
2) modify storage_policy module to remove test code policy
defaults and update related test code to provide them

Still a few todo items labeled XXX (todo in a different patch later):
- had to do some of the updater policy work to get things
  to function but supporting policies for the updater
  is a separate activity
- same kind of thing with ssync, had to hack in one minor
  thing to get things to work but a different activity
  will be entered on Trello for ssync policy support

Change-Id: I71eab0788325f715b2787e818d41dc3fa58a7046
Implements: blueprint storage-policies
'}]
commit_message:
Storage Policy / DiskFile Interface Support

The EC branch currently has minimal DiskFile support (one API) and
a big todo item for the rest.  This patch completes the support as
well as addresses a change to the one existing interface where we
used to pass the object directory name into DiskFile but have now
decided to pass in the policy index instead and let DiskFile build
the object directory name.  This patch includes:

- change interface param from directory name to policy index
- replace DiskFile DATADIR with Diskfile module method to
  return object directory name based on index (in all
  DiskFile and test files)
- do the same for ASYNCDIR, although not required, might
  be nice for debug/organization to have the async updates
  in per policy directories
- removal of object dir notion from StoragePoicy object

The patch also includes 2 updates unrelated to diskfile that were
suggested during review:
1) avoid use of extra parm in obj server HTTP verb handlers
2) modify storage_policy module to remove test code policy
defaults and update related test code to provide them

Still a few todo items labeled XXX (todo in a different patch later):
- had to do some of the updater policy work to get things
  to function but supporting policies for the updater
  is a separate activity
- same kind of thing with ssync, had to hack in one minor
  thing to get things to work but a different activity
  will be entered on Trello for ssync policy support

Change-Id: I71eab0788325f715b2787e818d41dc3fa58a7046
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-14 16:15:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_thirdparty/README.md', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/ryu', 'lib/neutron', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/bigswitch_floodlight', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/vmware_nsx', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/midonet', 'lib/neutron_thirdparty/trema', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'Add sanity check framework to verify neutron server/backend integration

Some Neutron plugins require controllers and multiple backend services
to operate correctly. This patch adds the framework for third party
plugins to run sanity checks after Neutron Server has started.

This simple addition may reveal potential configuration pitfalls
much earlier in the dev/test cycle, thus speeding up the build
churn process.

The first plugin that uses this framework is the VMware NSX one.

Closes-bug: #1265671

Change-Id: I17f9c5c8e828316ff03f0eff42ae4ae6c6c58733
'}]
commit_message:
Add sanity check framework to verify neutron server/backend integration

Some Neutron plugins require controllers and multiple backend services
to operate correctly. This patch adds the framework for third party
plugins to run sanity checks after Neutron Server has started.

This simple addition may reveal potential configuration pitfalls
much earlier in the dev/test cycle, thus speeding up the build
churn process.

The first plugin that uses this framework is the VMware NSX one.

Closes-bug: #1265671

Change-Id: I17f9c5c8e828316ff03f0eff42ae4ae6c6c58733

commit_message:
Fix configuring libvirt before installation

When enabling nova::migration::libvirt, it will try to configure
libvirtd.conf before installing libvirt package. This patchset adds
a dependency to make sure libvirt package has been installed when
running nova::migration::libvirt.

Change-Id: I981217c2bbecb276f25fa98d897e1da93d7e02a7
Closes-bug: #1254372
(cherry picked from commit 6c6e6be7e62775c76290d3ff39268d1b0105e915)

commit_message:
lockutils: move directory creation in lock class

We are going to implement a lock mechanism that does not rely on file
path at all, so there's no need to create such a hierarchy in advance.
Let's do that job in the class actually implementing the external lock
mechanism.

Change-Id: Ibd55ef6ee517f615dd6b398ebe72d1c6552f4675
Blueprint: lockutils-posix-ipc

subject: lockutils: remove lock_path parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-16 14:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_lockutils.py'], 'message': "lockutils: remove lock_path parameter

This remove the parameter lock_path so the configured lock_path is
always used instead. There's only a few places where this is used in
OpenStack, and it's not heavily justified to have it even in this
places.

This is needed to simplify the interface toward moving to IPC locking
mechanism. With such a locking mechanism in place, the lock_path
parameter has absolutely no sense. So isolating this to make it only
relevant to some part of the driver and not in the public interface
makes more sense.

Change-Id: I72bd683209090ae6e3911a709e4d213879508aca
Blueprint: lockutils-posix-ipc
"}]
commit_message:
lockutils: remove lock_path parameter

This remove the parameter lock_path so the configured lock_path is
always used instead. There's only a few places where this is used in
OpenStack, and it's not heavily justified to have it even in this
places.

This is needed to simplify the interface toward moving to IPC locking
mechanism. With such a locking mechanism in place, the lock_path
parameter has absolutely no sense. So isolating this to make it only
relevant to some part of the driver and not in the public interface
makes more sense.

Change-Id: I72bd683209090ae6e3911a709e4d213879508aca
Blueprint: lockutils-posix-ipc

lockutils: expand add_prefix

There is no need to build a function closure each time we run through
this code. It is more effective to expand the code right away, so let's
do that.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-16 14:10:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/lockutils.py'], 'message': 'lockutils: do not grab the lock in creators

The functions used to create the lock should not grab it, as it is not
their roles to do so. Instead, the lock is acquired in the decorator
using these functions.

Change-Id: Ia6d550869ae1c60883658af1c385d49728b6cd60
'}]
commit_message:
lockutils: do not grab the lock in creators

The functions used to create the lock should not grab it, as it is not
their roles to do so. Instead, the lock is acquired in the decorator
using these functions.

Change-Id: Ia6d550869ae1c60883658af1c385d49728b6cd60

commit_message:
one global-requirements.txt to rule them all

... and in the darkness bind them.

This moves the contents of requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt to a single file, global-requirements.txt.
This means that regardless of whether a requirement is in
either file it will get checked. This massively simplifies the
checking and upgrading of req and test-req files.

This also adds in a unit testing framework for the update.py
script to ensure it does what we think it does. This is
accomplished by making a fake tree with a set of req and test-req
files, running update.py, and ensuring the updates were made
that we expected. It includes testing for the oslo url case,
as well as test-requires.

(cherry picked from commit ec9cf616904d92509b8b44662e7097352d894484)
(cherry picked from commit f7fbf480daf8dbb09650a6de4f21c1a487bfdedb)

Change-Id: Ib9b86ade4cb8317509e218aec31f32e5d08f4035

commit_message:
Disconnect from iSCSI volume sessions after live migration

The live migration source host will now disconnect from
iSCSI volume sessions after the VM is successfully migrated
to the destination host.

Fixes bug 1132146

(cherry picked from commit 38e6e93a8102751b781d79da37249fe9c55f2575)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: I132869612bdf2baa810756586e643ea68ea8d8f6

commit_message:
Blackhole traffic not destined to Midonet port

* Add new route to blackhole traffic to external networks by default.
* Add new routes for individual VMs deployed on external networks,
  with higher priority than the 'blackhole' route.

Closes-bug: #1255005
Change-Id: I0c3d75cb6d00cca6d81067cd37303d8a318a2992

commit_message:
Upgrade requirements to alembic

currently the alembic>=0.4.1, in between 0.4.2 release and 0.5 release,
the argument name in 'drop_constraint' and 'create_index' methods changed
from tablename to table_name. it best to upgrade the requirements to
alembic >= 0.5.

Change-Id: Ia7abcf3dadd636cb39d0aecada12841ee078cdb5
Closes-bug: #1267284

subject: Fix race condition when changing node power states [PROOF OF CONCEPT]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-08 20:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/api/test_nodes.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/conductor/test_conductor_utils.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Fix race condition when changing node power states [PROOF OF CONCEPT]

NOTE: We would need to implement an 'intent lock' to fix the race
condition. The only benefit of this patch now is that it improves
the error feedback for the user by having a sync validation.

Instead of using the same asynchronously method for validation,
setting the target_power_state and doing the work to power on/off
a node, this patch split these tasks in 2 different methods:

- prepare_change_node_power_state() which is synchronous and is resposable
for validating and setting the target_power_state of the node.

- change_node_power_state() which is asynchronous and is responsable
for doing the work to power on/off the node.

Change-Id: I1d05c758615c23fb258e0a9738b18c5e0b521266
Partial-Bug: #1259910
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition when changing node power states [PROOF OF CONCEPT]

NOTE: We would need to implement an 'intent lock' to fix the race
condition. The only benefit of this patch now is that it improves
the error feedback for the user by having a sync validation.

Instead of using the same asynchronously method for validation,
setting the target_power_state and doing the work to power on/off
a node, this patch split these tasks in 2 different methods:

- prepare_change_node_power_state() which is synchronous and is resposable
for validating and setting the target_power_state of the node.

- change_node_power_state() which is asynchronous and is responsable
for doing the work to power on/off the node.

Change-Id: I1d05c758615c23fb258e0a9738b18c5e0b521266
Partial-Bug: #1259910

commit_message:
User tokens handling when revoking role assignment

Prevent user tokens being deleted when role assignment is removed.
When a role assignment is removed for a user in a project, the
tokens for that user are removed. By adding the project_id to the
call 'self._delete_tokens_for_user(user_id, project_id)' just the token
for the given project is deleted.

Change-Id: Ie5a63e8bf179e624b5743d795ec8703d452db0da
Closes-Bug: #1252341

subject: memoize cat /proc/pid/cmdline in n-net
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 19:38:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "memoize cat /proc/pid/cmdline in n-net

We don't need to keep calling 'cat /proc/pid/cmdline' for the same pid,
as the cmdline will remain the same for the duration of the process so
memoize the result.

Change-Id: Id6725e414e59c920f5c2347180be35c46032bb02
"}]
commit_message:
memoize cat /proc/pid/cmdline in n-net

We don't need to keep calling 'cat /proc/pid/cmdline' for the same pid,
as the cmdline will remain the same for the duration of the process so
memoize the result.

Change-Id: Id6725e414e59c920f5c2347180be35c46032bb02

commit_message:
xenapi: stop server destroy on live_migrate errors

Currently where there are errors after live-migration has completed, the
server is destroyed, which for XenAPI driver, means the server no longer
exists, because XenServer has already deleted the source VM.

Closes-Bug: #1262206
Change-Id: I7f827f5d972da26f5d1edae7a22fb45a1f5dd6ca

commit_message:
Add way to group exceptions in DependencyTaskGroup

DependencyTaskGroup currently aborts execution if any exceptions are
raised.  This commit provides a way of aggregating all the exceptions
during execution and re-raising them only at the end.

blueprint stack-check

Change-Id: I6af314cc112f9286c8b38739870c6fa8b4ba9b5a

subject: Fix comparison with singletons
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-13 07:45:44.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_common_http.py'], 'message': 'Fix comparison with singletons

Many places in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

Change-Id: I232136ce49afdb8bf78b42221454540471d12c23
Closes-Bug: #1259023
'}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons

Many places in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

Change-Id: I232136ce49afdb8bf78b42221454540471d12c23
Closes-Bug: #1259023

commit_message:
Make LoadBalancer nested stack template configurable

Reviving work originally posted by Angus Salkeld under
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21405/

This is to enable the various distros to easily override the
hard-coded default nested template (which currently only supports
Fedora 17) with a template approporate to their distro, and
enables deployers to specify their own template (although the
latter use-case will probably be catered for via a provider
template implementation long-term).

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/loadbalancer.py

Partial-Bug: #1234375
Co-Authored-By: Angus Salkeld <angus@salkeld.id.au>
(cherry picked from commit 746a0ed4ad2273d0e67b896efbb6d7a69f9f4c77)
Change-Id: I0a4eccb23b2eebbf31b7aabf0fe85ab31f0ca971

commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This second patch inlcudes the other half of the files touched by these
changes to ease the review.

Change-Id: I9965ae158f3e0dc49b93b9357a32a302ac7dc735
Closes-Bug: #1259023

commit_message:

When creating sample without parameter "meter_name" in ceilometer CLI,
The result is 'counter_name' ,the parameter "meter_name"(i.e.counter_name)
isrequired,but it is not in the help messages of "ceilometer sample-create".

Closes-bug: #1267378

commit_message:
VMware: unnecessary session reconnection

An error FAULT_NOT_AUTHENTICATED could imply that there is a problem
with the backend or that no values were found (for example there are
no running VMS). In the latter case the connection should not
be restarted.

The patch also ensures that the session is restarted if there are
connection issues.

This issue occasionally causes CI issues with minesweeper.

Closes-bug: #1265512

Co-authored-by: Shawn Harsock <hartsocks@vmware.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-09 22:29:36.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Cut tempest concurrency in half

While a group of us were investigating the top gate bugs today, at least
half of them are due to performance issues where nova isn't able to keep
up.  This change is to test the theory that dialing back the test load
will increase reliability of the gate.

We also have a lot of good data and ideas on how we can improve nova
performance (in particular, nova-network).  Hopefully we could turn this
back up in the future.

Change-Id: I2338ebf5df8bced935e9ed9b0ebd2d4e859b5dbe
"}]
commit_message:
Cut tempest concurrency in half

While a group of us were investigating the top gate bugs today, at least
half of them are due to performance issues where nova isn't able to keep
up.  This change is to test the theory that dialing back the test load
will increase reliability of the gate.

We also have a lot of good data and ideas on how we can improve nova
performance (in particular, nova-network).  Hopefully we could turn this
back up in the future.

Change-Id: I2338ebf5df8bced935e9ed9b0ebd2d4e859b5dbe

commit_message:
Relocated "Neutron deployment use cases" section to improve flow

I think placing the "Neutron deployment use cases" section before the
"Installing Networking services" section may drive people to learn
more about typical Networking architectures before proceeding with
installation.

Change-Id: I0d7d9cb955a687d230f2e5621420534af7084cd4
Closes-Bug: #1263716

subject: Refactor CIDR field to use netaddr.IPNetwork
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 19:06:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_fields.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_security_group_rule.py', 'nova/objects/security_group_rule.py', 'nova/virt/firewall.py'], 'message': 'Refactor CIDR field to use netaddr.IPNetwork

This makes the CIDR field become the IPNetwork field (and associate
versioned fields). It also uses the netaddr.IPNetwork class, which
is what should have been done in the first place.

Wire format is unchanged, so we can make this without any version

Change-Id: I1a3ab6a5f4c624f3da0ab1c78c75c6f1e474541f
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor CIDR field to use netaddr.IPNetwork

This makes the CIDR field become the IPNetwork field (and associate
versioned fields). It also uses the netaddr.IPNetwork class, which
is what should have been done in the first place.

Wire format is unchanged, so we can make this without any version
bumps or upgrade impact.

Related to blueprint nova-network-objects

Change-Id: I1a3ab6a5f4c624f3da0ab1c78c75c6f1e474541f

commit_message:

subject: Add a modifiable keyword for API validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 09:19:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_api_validation.py', 'nova/api/validation/__init__.py'], 'message': "Add a modifiable keyword for API validation

Current validation framework checks a request body with keyword 'body'
because the wsgi framework passes it with the keyword.
However some core APIs(create a server API, etc.) passes it with the
other argument(server_dict, etc) to its extension methods.

For validating a request body at each extension method, this patch
adds a modifiable keyword.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I56d5eab8f6d99934501357af3d7c6a5a0535fbe7
"}]
commit_message:
Add a modifiable keyword for API validation

Current validation framework checks a request body with keyword 'body'
because the wsgi framework passes it with the keyword.
However some core APIs(create a server API, etc.) passes it with the
other argument(server_dict, etc) to its extension methods.

For validating a request body at each extension method, this patch
adds a modifiable keyword.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: I56d5eab8f6d99934501357af3d7c6a5a0535fbe7

Add function to monkey patched official clients to handle
retries on rate limiting errors.
Each client has an http client within, with something like
a request method. The request method is replaced with a new
request_with_retry, function of the original method.
For Swift using the existing retry functionality.

commit_message:
Implements official clients with retry

Add function to monkey patched official clients to handle
retries on rate limiting errors.
Each client has an http client within, with something like
a request method. The request method is replaced with a new
request_with_retry, function of the original method.
For Swift using the existing retry functionality.

Also fixes self.config -> CONF

Closes-bug: #1250809
Closes-bug: #1187737

Change-Id: Iafad6b4047b860b88dce5743dcb83a438107958c

commit_message:
Grant group member to has write access on the secret key store path

The httpd subprocess is running by apache user who is under apache
group, we need save the secret key store file into a path which apache
user has write access.

Close-bug: #1267691

Change-Id: Ia7effc95d62404c2b2901273909d69871c2d6899

commit_message:
move datastore manager to the datastore version

This moves the datastore manager field to the datastore version object
so that we can have managers per datastore version and they can be
shared if nessesary.

implements blueprint move-manager-to-datastore-version

Change-Id: I1c889a01005ec482bcd44e0e19475bc972e1af04

commit_message:
datastore manager moved to datastore version

Moving the manager from the datastore object to the datastore version
object to allow managers to be changed per version and this change is
reflected in the calls made to trove-manage to update the datastore and
datastore version.

paritally implements bp move-manager-to-datastore-version

Change-Id: I3c720153cbb08a8a3278debc3936854209576241

commit_message:
remove references and uses of fixed_range wrt nova.conf

Fixes: bug #1269876

As per commit https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1f6c4f5,
fixed_range in nova.conf is deprecated.  We don't need to be setting it
any more.

Change-Id: Ie9371a54c3bcbad3c45b851b67f78c38c43940bf

This bugfix allows ring_script.rb to handler later versions
of swift-ring-builder that could be required in upgrade or
downgrade scenerios in the stable/grizzly branch.

commit_message:

misc.Failure object from an exception directly. This
commit adds the 'from_exception' class method to create
misc.Failure in such way.

commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

Change-Id: Ic73c99034638ec092192d11e37671edbba0e48ef
Partial-Bug: #1195915

commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function thata will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

subject: Update toci_gate_test.sh to use the broker.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-01-15 08:14:56.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Update toci_gate_test.sh to use the broker.

toci_gate_test now enters the broker and chains into toci_devtest.sh
via test-envclient. Under the hood this is doing:

$ testenv-client -b <geardserver>:4730 -- ./toci_devtest.sh

This depends on both a gearman broker and at least one registered
test env being deployed.

toci_devtest includes the code to apply the broker supplied SSH key to
the system and then attempts to run the first few stages of devtest,
preserving the test environment definintion from the broker.

The astute of eye may observe that we haven't solved how to pass the gear
server host into the test environment yet... that may require an
openstack-infra/config patch.

Change-Id: I53ce4ca687283a924ea055267ea90f20d6632651
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update toci_gate_test.sh to use the broker.

toci_gate_test now enters the broker and chains into toci_devtest.sh
via test-envclient. Under the hood this is doing:

$ testenv-client -b <geardserver>:4730 -- ./toci_devtest.sh

This depends on both a gearman broker and at least one registered
test env being deployed.

toci_devtest includes the code to apply the broker supplied SSH key to
the system and then attempts to run the first few stages of devtest,
preserving the test environment definintion from the broker.

The astute of eye may observe that we haven't solved how to pass the gear
server host into the test environment yet... that may require an
openstack-infra/config patch.

Change-Id: I53ce4ca687283a924ea055267ea90f20d6632651
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

subject: Only add ceilometer user to nova group if using compute agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 19:57:44.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ceilometer_agent_compute_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/agent/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Only add ceilometer user to nova group if using compute agent

When using ceilometer outside of the compute context (ex: with the
swift middleware), puppet-ceilometer attempts to add the user to
the nova group which does not (and probably should not) exist on
the swift nodes.

Change-Id: I6cc68152325a967c024ce611f92a90ce0afba8cc
(cherry picked from commit d064997cd4c50d9b5365fe2ffca60e14a86b08e1)
'}]
commit_message:
Only add ceilometer user to nova group if using compute agent

When using ceilometer outside of the compute context (ex: with the
swift middleware), puppet-ceilometer attempts to add the user to
the nova group which does not (and probably should not) exist on
the swift nodes.

Change-Id: I6cc68152325a967c024ce611f92a90ce0afba8cc
(cherry picked from commit d064997cd4c50d9b5365fe2ffca60e14a86b08e1)

commit_message:
Add Tripleo CI user.

This will permit Tripleo CI to obtain IPs from neutron in
ci-overcloud.tripleo.org(the ci overcloud). Once merged the user will
need to be added manually to the ci-overcloud, this should eventually be
automated and persisted when we move to the cd-overcloud.

Change-Id: I9c312fdc71895544ed34bfe4c3abf6aa5a2ea4ef

commit_message:
Add a db check for CHARSET=utf8

This is to prevent confusing migration errors caused by
tables having mixed character sets like latin1.

Change-Id: I19da8d5e2d972c78d0f9fb4325445f538ed35600
Closes-bug: #1261605

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-15 22:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['tools/config/README', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'openstack/common/config/generator.py'], 'message': "Use entry points to discover options in libraries

When generating the sample configuration file, we want to include
options defined in libraries used by the application (especially
oslo libraries). Add a section to the sample generator to look
at entry points in the 'oslo.config.opts' namespace and include
their return values in the output.

Implements: blueprint improve-config-discovery-for-docs
Related-Bug: #1241566

Change-Id: I635cd8e60ca687851c9dd891667ecc2ca3e8720c
"}]
commit_message:
Use entry points to discover options in libraries

When generating the sample configuration file, we want to include
options defined in libraries used by the application (especially
oslo libraries). Add a section to the sample generator to look
at entry points in the 'oslo.config.opts' namespace and include
their return values in the output.

Implements: blueprint improve-config-discovery-for-docs
Related-Bug: #1241566

Change-Id: I635cd8e60ca687851c9dd891667ecc2ca3e8720c

commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that will
accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password

Change-Id: Ifdb5c7b3f590431aaa7ffc021cdee34899ac8c15
Partial-Bug: #1195915

commit_message:
Enable setting up translation handler via CONF

Just like with other log settings, enable setting up the
TranslationHandler via a CONF option, outside the logging.conf
file. The patch adds a new CONF option called 'log_additional_locale'.

Change-Id: I71e0a564e13b782d741a4e5eafe30bf82569a02c

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from Oslo

The Message class in Oslo, in charge of providing delayed translation
features, was improved and a new feature was implemented to enable
creation of addition logs in different locales.

Latest Oslo commit:
221c37d Allow the Message class to have non-English default locales

bp i18n-messages

Change-Id: I9ac8a0da9ea3b7b393f81c255332d83bbcab1da9

commit_message:
lockutils: remove local usage

This doesn't seem like it's used by anything any more, so let's just
remove this local usage altogether. This also drops the lock check from
RPC, which shouldn't be a problem considering that this library is
already deprecated altogether.

Change-Id: I87ff0338adcfa092fd21acad5cf41d5746be1efe

subject: test: Use srmock header_dict in preparation for Falcon 0.1.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 19:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/queues/transport/wsgi/test_queue_lifecycle.py'], 'message': 'test: Use srmock header_dict in preparation for Falcon 0.1.8

Falcon 0.1.8 returns lowercased headers to the client. This *should* be
OK, since well-behaved clients treat headers as case-insensitive. However,
srmock exposes the response headers directly and we do an assert using
them without taking into account case of the header name.

This patch modifies that particular assert to use srmock.header_dict
instead, since in 0.1.8 that is implemented using a case-insensitive
dict.

Change-Id: Ib7435a0a51ccf1d5d1ab8da672a12cf3233f9e8e
'}]
commit_message:
test: Use srmock header_dict in preparation for Falcon 0.1.8

Falcon 0.1.8 returns lowercased headers to the client. This *should* be
OK, since well-behaved clients treat headers as case-insensitive. However,
srmock exposes the response headers directly and we do an assert using
them without taking into account case of the header name.

This patch modifies that particular assert to use srmock.header_dict
instead, since in 0.1.8 that is implemented using a case-insensitive
dict.

Change-Id: Ib7435a0a51ccf1d5d1ab8da672a12cf3233f9e8e

The last slash is unnecessary, it only causes redundant slash when
generate api uri, which already treated as a bug in Ceilometer.

Closes-Bug: #1269496
backport: havana
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/63279/

commit_message:
Policy management for Climate

Implements policies in Climate with unittests based on Oslo.
Tight integration with Context as it will populate to Context
if user is admin or not based on policy.json

In order to make that work, please add policy.json to /etc/climate

Decorator @policy.authorize allows enforcing policy checks on
controllers.

Implements bp:climate-policy

commit_message:
renamed OS-IDP spec file to OS-FEDERATION

This could have been done as part of a previous change [1] which
expanded the scope of the extension, but it made the diff in gerrit very
difficult to see additional changes. This is ONLY the file rename.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59848/

Change-Id: Ibce5940b61926028774f9c02e533d67ca958662f

subject: Allow different login methods to be used with kombu connections.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 17:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py', 'tests/unit/rpc/test_kombu.py'], 'message': 'Allow different login methods to be used with kombu connections.

Currently it is not possible to modify the login method used with
kombu connections via configuration files, and requires modifying
the source code to actually add a login method in the first place.
This adds a configuration option (and default) which are passed to
the underlying kombu connection.

Unit tests have also been corrected to the best of my knowledge.

Closes-Bug: #1269867
Change-Id: I6ff421a65b0e6f93db76d91e9362cd63d9170299
'}]
commit_message:
Allow different login methods to be used with kombu connections.

Currently it is not possible to modify the login method used with
kombu connections via configuration files, and requires modifying
the source code to actually add a login method in the first place.
This adds a configuration option (and default) which are passed to
the underlying kombu connection.

Unit tests have also been corrected to the best of my knowledge.

Closes-Bug: #1269867
Change-Id: I6ff421a65b0e6f93db76d91e9362cd63d9170299

commit_message:
Add pywbem to global-requirements.txt

The EMC volume driver in Cinder requires the pywbem package to
be available.  This is the first part of the changes required to
enable the package being automatically included by Cinder.

The patch adds Shard support of the client. This will allow users to
create and delete shards from Marconi. The API requires the Marconi
instance to be and admin instance. However, there are no checks,
restrictions, yet.

This patch doesn't implement Shards listing. As soon as the
MessageIterator lands, it'll be possible to reuse that code for the

Partially-Implements blueprint: shard-management

Change-Id: I932c98d68a4a81b710dbea75a6bac123b7afaa08

commit_message:
Add shard support to the client

The patch adds Shard support of the client. This will allow users to
create and delete shards from Marconi. The API requires the Marconi
instance to be and admin instance. However, there are no checks,
restrictions, yet.

This patch doesn't implement Shards listing. As soon as the
MessageIterator lands, it'll be possible to reuse that code for the
ShardsIterator.

Partially-Implements blueprint: shard-management
Partially-Implements blueprint: python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: I932c98d68a4a81b710dbea75a6bac123b7afaa08

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-16 03:50:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'DO NOT MERGE: test out eatmydata

LD_PRELOAD library that disables all forms of writing data safely to
disk. fsync() becomes a NO-OP, O_SYNC is removed etc.

The idea is to use in testing to get faster test runs where real
durability is not required.

https://launchpad.net/libeatmydata

Change-Id: I97b425dc8ea97007a3ae1865e4d831ed10a47b57
'}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: test out eatmydata

LD_PRELOAD library that disables all forms of writing data safely to
disk. fsync() becomes a NO-OP, O_SYNC is removed etc.

The idea is to use in testing to get faster test runs where real
durability is not required.

https://launchpad.net/libeatmydata

Change-Id: I97b425dc8ea97007a3ae1865e4d831ed10a47b57

subject: Use the JSON description to probe the seed VM.
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-01-16 06:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_seed.sh', 'scripts/get-vm-ip', 'scripts/install-dependencies', 'scripts/boot-seed-vm'], 'message': 'Use the JSON description to probe the seed VM.

This adds a dependency on jq to let us cleanly write autodetected seed
VM IP addresses into the test file, which will simplify things later
on in our workflow. Using the datafile is preferrable to complex
checks in devtest which is afterall meant to be as much manual as
script.

Change-Id: I81e49d16077c564dd1e5d3e6f6e7a26e7c56ef5c
'}]
commit_message:
Use the JSON description to probe the seed VM.

This adds a dependency on jq to let us cleanly write autodetected seed
VM IP addresses into the test file, which will simplify things later
on in our workflow. Using the datafile is preferrable to complex
checks in devtest which is afterall meant to be as much manual as
script.

Change-Id: I81e49d16077c564dd1e5d3e6f6e7a26e7c56ef5c

Update RPC code from oslo

The common RPC code has been updated to include the following:
    8575d87af49ea276341908f83c8c51db13afca44
    8b2b0b743e84ceed7841cf470afed6a5da8e1d07
    23f602940c64ba408d77ceb8f5ba0f67ee4a18ef
    6d0a6c3083218cdac52758a8b6aac6b03402c658
    7cac1ac1bd9df36d4e5183afac3b643df10b1d4d
    8159efddabb09dd9b7c99963ff7c9de0a6c62b62

Updated to include the following in modules in openstack-common.conf:
py3kcompat, sslutils, and versionutils.

The update also includes imports from the RPC code

Change-Id: I84c5b8e2b17da0018dd69ecb354d123a609afe98

Fixed spelling of datum in existing action.

Horizon filter glance image list because 'aki', 'ari' type of images
can not be launchable.

However, it is better to provide full capacity with glance in
Horizon.

Reasons:
1. Horizon allow upload those images. It brings confusion if not
show them
2. The filtering strange behavior when pagination is enabled

Changed to show all images in Horizon, but 'aki', 'ari' type of
images are not allowed to launch or create volume.

Change-Id: Ic92fc97d7327bb2525c0155646487dd685e99c79
Closes-Bug: #1257180

commit_message:
Do not filter image list from glance api

Horizon filter glance image list because 'aki', 'ari' type of images
can not be launchable.

However, it is better to provide full capacity with glance in
Horizon.

Reasons:
1. Horizon allow upload those images. It brings confusion if not
show them
2. The filtering strange behavior when pagination is enabled

Changed to show all images in Horizon, but 'aki', 'ari' type of
images are not allowed to launch or create volume.

Change-Id: Ic92fc97d7327bb2525c0155646487dd685e99c79
Closes-Bug: #1257180

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-15 14:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Fix updating device names when defaulting

If the virt driver does not support defaulting device names, the default
behaviour of defaulting them in the manager was calling the conductor
block_device_mapping_update method with the wrong arguments, which
caused a TypeError and ultimately a failure to boot the instance.

This patch fixed the signature and adds a test that exercises it so
that it does not regress.

Closes-bug: #1260806
Change-Id: I6116540c9aca4847afacf80b3d1e0c027c364159
'}]
commit_message:
Fix updating device names when defaulting

If the virt driver does not support defaulting device names, the default
behaviour of defaulting them in the manager was calling the conductor
block_device_mapping_update method with the wrong arguments, which
caused a TypeError and ultimately a failure to boot the instance.

This patch fixed the signature and adds a test that exercises it so
that it does not regress.

Closes-bug: #1260806
Change-Id: I6116540c9aca4847afacf80b3d1e0c027c364159

subject: tests: pass /dev/null as config for mongod
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-08 14:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['run-tests.sh'], 'message': "tests: pass /dev/null as config for mongod

On certain system, such as Darwin, the default mongod binary is a
wrapper adding a default configuration file. Let's specify that there's
no configuration file to read, otherwise a log file is used instead of
stdout.

Change-Id: I56c72cd61399405fd57d6e3f2b1f53ca6a395835
"}]
commit_message:
tests: pass /dev/null as config for mongod

On certain system, such as Darwin, the default mongod binary is a
wrapper adding a default configuration file. Let's specify that there's
no configuration file to read, otherwise a log file is used instead of
stdout.

Change-Id: I56c72cd61399405fd57d6e3f2b1f53ca6a395835

commit_message:
Add a swift-enabled version of WordCount to edp-examples

The edp-wordcount example includes source code and instructions on
how to build the jar and run it from the Oozie command line or the
Savanna UI. WordCount will work with hdfs paths, or with swift paths
as long as the proper configs are set.

Change-Id: I9ac728de505d874fd50a6baf75b062d5b622f3d0

Closes-Bug: #1265688

commit_message:
Fix use the fact that empty sequences are false

For sequences(strings, lists, tuples), in order to consistent with
pep8 recommendations, 'if len(seq)' should be replaced with 'if seq',
and 'if not len(seq)' should be replaced with 'if not seq'.

Change-Id: Ie7b6afbde07bb57a05b36d92a079c5355945b262
Closes-Bug: #1265688

commit_message:
Remove heat-cli-guide

The heat command line clients are documented now better in the
OpenStack End User Guide:

http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/heat-stack-create.html
http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/heat_client_commands.html

The content here is thus not needed anymore, as the README.rst says:
"This documentation should eventually end up in the OpenStack
documentation repositories `api-site` and `openstack-manuals`."

Change-Id: I297252d7f8eee383ce6252a5db44111630fbe29b

subject: VMware: driver - assert open session before operations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 15:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'message': 'VMware: driver - assert open session before operations

There will be multiple points in the driver where the code
has been state-ful presuming preserved "open session state"
this assumption will have to be baked out of the code a
line at a time.

In this example I'm leaning on the ability to create/join
an open session.

The use of self._session should be treated as "code smell" an
indication that something may be wrong (but not necessarily so).

Change-Id: I48da8faaeba83af3052ae6a35f8fca63dd580fd5
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: driver - assert open session before operations

There will be multiple points in the driver where the code
has been state-ful presuming preserved "open session state"
this assumption will have to be baked out of the code a
line at a time.

In this example I'm leaning on the ability to create/join
an open session.

The use of self._session should be treated as "code smell" an
indication that something may be wrong (but not necessarily so).

Change-Id: I48da8faaeba83af3052ae6a35f8fca63dd580fd5

commit_message:
add a sar filter that makes it report on one line

reading sar input with multiple flags is somewhat problematic,
because it's tons of interspersed headers. So build something with
does a pivot filter to make it possible to get this all on one
line.

commit_message:
Configure plugins by name

To configure core plugin or service plugins, instead of using class names,
simpler names can also be used, ex:

service_plugins = router, firewall, lbaas

For compatibility with previous versions, the class name of a plugin can be
specified instead of its entrypoint name, ex:

service_plugins = router, neutron.services.firewall.fwaas_plugin.FirewallPlugin, lbaas

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint config-plugin-by-name
Change-Id: Ia4aaa1d305b160a4d6dab9e227c744727a4c78c2

subject: Symlink correct element install type
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-15 19:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/source-repositories/README.md', 'elements/source-repositories/extra-data.d/98-source-repositories'], 'message': 'Symlink correct element install type

The source-repositories element will now symlink the install scripts
corresponding to the set install type for an element into the install.d
directory.

Different install types are implemented by elements by writing scripts to do
the install type under install.d/<element-name>-<install-type>-install
directories.

For example, the nova element would provide:

nova/install.d/nova-package-install/74-nova
nova/install.d/nova-source-install/74-nova

source-repositories will create the following symlink for the package
install type:

$TMP_HOOKS_PATH/install.d/74-nova -> nova-package-install/74-nova

Or, for the source install type:

$TMP_HOOKS_PATH/install.d/74-nova -> nova-source-install/74-nova

Change-Id: I1bfaf39e5a98b2af904fbc6d674dbada30b27ed9
'}]
commit_message:
Symlink correct element install type

The source-repositories element will now symlink the install scripts
corresponding to the set install type for an element into the install.d
directory.

Different install types are implemented by elements by writing scripts to do
the install type under install.d/<element-name>-<install-type>-install
directories.

For example, the nova element would provide:

nova/install.d/nova-package-install/74-nova
nova/install.d/nova-source-install/74-nova

source-repositories will create the following symlink for the package
install type:

$TMP_HOOKS_PATH/install.d/74-nova -> nova-package-install/74-nova

Or, for the source install type:

$TMP_HOOKS_PATH/install.d/74-nova -> nova-source-install/74-nova

Change-Id: I1bfaf39e5a98b2af904fbc6d674dbada30b27ed9

subject: dib-run-parts should dereference symlinks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 19:57:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dib-run-parts/bin/dib-run-parts'], 'message': 'dib-run-parts should dereference symlinks

dib-run-parts should dereference symlinks, and if they point to an
executable file, execute that file as a script. This can be accomplished
by using the xtype predicate in the find command instead of the type
predicate.

This change is needed so that we can dynamically symlink hook scripts
into hook directories such as install.d at runtime to support different
install types.

Change-Id: I933e7f4b4dcf16956841d8c14aa63b0f9a18fc5d
'}]
commit_message:
dib-run-parts should dereference symlinks

dib-run-parts should dereference symlinks, and if they point to an
executable file, execute that file as a script. This can be accomplished
by using the xtype predicate in the find command instead of the type
predicate.

This change is needed so that we can dynamically symlink hook scripts
into hook directories such as install.d at runtime to support different
install types.

Change-Id: I933e7f4b4dcf16956841d8c14aa63b0f9a18fc5d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-22 23:22:11.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/policy.json', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Adds user_data extension to nova.api.v3.extensions

Although the user_data extension does not create a resource
or controller extension and only implements server.create and
server.create.deserialize entry points it does need to be listed as
a nova.api.v3.extension entry point as the whitelist check
operates on that entry point.

This does not add any runtime overhead and allows user_data to be
specified in the whitelist.

Change-Id: Ia8ac2fa150ab2fe9c1848c5a7ddc416952adf0e4
'}]
commit_message:
Adds user_data extension to nova.api.v3.extensions

Although the user_data extension does not create a resource
or controller extension and only implements server.create and
server.create.deserialize entry points it does need to be listed as
a nova.api.v3.extension entry point as the whitelist check
operates on that entry point.

This does not add any runtime overhead and allows user_data to be
specified in the whitelist.

Also adds missing discoverable policy for the user data extension

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ia8ac2fa150ab2fe9c1848c5a7ddc416952adf0e4

subject: set correct include line for rhel/centos in /etc/tgt/targets.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 16:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/targets.conf.erb'], 'message': 'set correct include line for rhel/centos in /etc/tgt/targets.conf

Fixes: bug #1269475

If using the default lvmiscsi driver for cinder, rhel and ubuntu look in
different places for their include files. At the moment, the following line
gets added to /etc/tgt/targets.conf on rhel systems:

include /var/lib/cinder/volumes/*

This patch changes it to the correct line:

include /etc/cinder/volumes/*

Change-Id: I43b5a58b3cd77a2218cdaec3c67f3289a4e10d50
'}]
commit_message:
set correct include line for rhel/centos in /etc/tgt/targets.conf

Fixes: bug #1269475

If using the default lvmiscsi driver for cinder, rhel and ubuntu look in
different places for their include files. At the moment, the following line
gets added to /etc/tgt/targets.conf on rhel systems:

include /var/lib/cinder/volumes/*

This patch changes it to the correct line:

include /etc/cinder/volumes/*

Change-Id: I43b5a58b3cd77a2218cdaec3c67f3289a4e10d50

Change-Id: I3f2bf1a4c53e22c66954e1069a1bcd618a1fd52b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in the api 'os-migrations'

The return is not what we are expecting:
  migration-list: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'

The conversion of the object nova.objects.Migration into a list
is not applied automatically.

Change-Id: I3f2bf1a4c53e22c66954e1069a1bcd618a1fd52b

commit_message:
Add _() to rackspace resource strings

As part of fix to bug #1249217, all the translation strings were
included in _(), but rackspace resources were ignored.
This change is to fix translation strings in rackspace resources.

Change-Id: I2a422746693136636cc137e2e9cc1bd3a7e6bb01
Closes-Bug: #1261545

the "create backup" action is incorrectly shown for a non-active
database instance in the database instances table. now, only if the
instance is active, will the action/button appear.

in addition, non-active instances are now excluded from the dropdown

commit_message:
Remove Create Backup Action For Non-Active

the "create backup" action is incorrectly shown for a non-active
database instance in the database instances table. now, only if the
instance is active, will the action/button appear.

in addition, non-active instances are now excluded from the dropdown
in the create-backup workflow.

Change-Id: Id9fdeab84ad91b96ba1a9f07ee6d1af87b6320f7
Closes-Bug: #1268260

commit_message:
New message added informing how to exit fullscreen mode.

Fixing this bug in the full screen mode involves patching it
on noVNC codebase.
This patch adds a comment for how to exit the full screen
mode using the browser's back button.

subject: Whitelist external netifaces requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 12:05:44.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces  package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: Ia8d5ce8152237a67da4828f3c70cf9f367d44d41
Partial-Bug: #1266513
"}]
commit_message:
Whitelist external netifaces requirement

* tox.ini(testenv.install_command): Use the --allow-external and
--allow-insecure options so that pip 1.5 and later will assent to
retrieve the netifaces  package even though it's not hosted on PyPI.
The --allow-insecure option is aliased to a clearer
--allow-unverified wording in 1.5, but the old form is being used to
avoid breaking users of 1.4.x and will be valid at least through
1.6.x according to comments in the pip source.

Change-Id: Ia8d5ce8152237a67da4828f3c70cf9f367d44d41
Partial-Bug: #1266513

subject: ERRORs in ceilometer-acentral log after succesful tempest run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 23:14:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/objectstore/test_swift.py', 'ceilometer/objectstore/swift.py'], 'message': 'ERRORs in ceilometer-acentral log after succesful tempest run

swift pollster tries to run against all projects (even those not
associated with the project-scoped token). this causes issues when
keystoneauth middleware in swift tries to validate token with
project.

change logic to only work against the project the token is related
to.

Change-Id: I26db9ffad5e787cb064b14c912fc76e63b66ffb7
Closes-Bug: #1268730
'}]
commit_message:
ERRORs in ceilometer-acentral log after succesful tempest run

swift pollster tries to run against all projects (even those not
associated with the project-scoped token). this causes issues when
keystoneauth middleware in swift tries to validate token with
project.

change logic to only work against the project the token is related
to.

Change-Id: I26db9ffad5e787cb064b14c912fc76e63b66ffb7
Closes-Bug: #1268730

subject: Change instances config_drive column from string to Boolean
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-08 07:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/230_change_config_drive_from_string_to_boolean.py'], 'message': "Change instances config_drive column from string to Boolean

config drive feature was added early in commit d963e25906b75a48c75b6e589deb2a53f75d6ee3,
config_drive column is varchar type but only store Boolean value, so when using
nova boot --config-drive true to build instances, a string 'True' is stored in DB,
The function still works because a string is regard as True in statement, this patch
changes column type from varchar to Boolean, and changes the string 'True' to a Boolean
type.

Closes-Bug: 1193438

Change-Id: I6c2951a890dc213a053e0ccbc0685ecf0afbdf1a
"}]
commit_message:
Change instances config_drive column from string to Boolean

config drive feature was added early in commit d963e25906b75a48c75b6e589deb2a53f75d6ee3,
config_drive column is varchar type but only store Boolean value, so when using
nova boot --config-drive true to build instances, a string 'True' is stored in DB,
The function still works because a string is regard as True in statement, this patch
changes column type from varchar to Boolean, and changes the string 'True' to a Boolean
type.

Closes-Bug: 1193438

Change-Id: I6c2951a890dc213a053e0ccbc0685ecf0afbdf1a

commit_message:
Fix exception catch when CPU Host features cannot be parsed

libvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_SUPPORT is of type integer, so it will
never be thrown by libvirt. Change it to libvirt.libvirtError
which will be thrown by the current implementation of libvirt.
Add testcase.

Related-Bug: #1262723

Change-Id: I98b95e48ac647784a751b6eb405c861004dd136b

Added support for bash completion, the implementation

commit_message:
Support bash completion

Added support for bash completion, the implementation
is based on python-cinderclient and python-novaclient.

The completer function caches output of "glance bash-completion"
to run faster, and distinguishes between flags and commands
(based on already typed text).

Change-Id: I22b9117fa0dd28e351c2d6062237216424fd88cd

subject: Undeprecate run_tests.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-06 15:45:37.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Undeprecate run_tests.sh

tox is not completely serving our needs,
it has some startup costs, and the ways
to do many of the standard tasks (run until
first failure, for example) are not documented.

Until we have a full replacement for
run_tests.sh, keep it for documentation and
ensuring the unit tests are fast and easy to run.

This change also modifies the flag for running to first failure.

Change-Id: I879db5bd94bfdb323f85356ace67042ff262cf18
'}]
commit_message:
Undeprecate run_tests.sh

tox is not completely serving our needs,
it has some startup costs, and the ways
to do many of the standard tasks (run until
first failure, for example) are not documented.

Until we have a full replacement for
run_tests.sh, keep it for documentation and
ensuring the unit tests are fast and easy to run.

This change also modifies the flag for running to first failure.

Change-Id: I879db5bd94bfdb323f85356ace67042ff262cf18

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 91, 'name': 'Alvaro', 'email': 'aloga@ifca.unican.es', 'username': 'aloga'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 7579, 'name': 'jan grant', 'email': 'jan.grant@hpe.com', 'username': 'jang'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-14 22:38:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/test_libvirt.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.

Bug 1195877

The problem lies with the truncation of backing file names at the
first underscore character. On a reboot, nova-compute checks the
backing images exist. Typically, they will do; however, instead
of looking for an "ephemeral_XXX" file, it hunts for "ephemeral".
This won't exist, triggering code that attempts to pull the whole
image again from glance(!)

Lacking credentials, the attempt to fetch the image will fail,
ultimately resulting in the instance going to an ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iabcc7a1ffd248c22a747a1ddc7863d2b386d409a
(cherry picked from commit 65386c91910ee03d947c2b8bcc226a53c30e060a)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix spurious backing file existence check.

Bug 1195877

The problem lies with the truncation of backing file names at the
first underscore character. On a reboot, nova-compute checks the
backing images exist. Typically, they will do; however, instead
of looking for an "ephemeral_XXX" file, it hunts for "ephemeral".
This won't exist, triggering code that attempts to pull the whole
image again from glance(!)

Lacking credentials, the attempt to fetch the image will fail,
ultimately resulting in the instance going to an ERROR state.

Change-Id: Iabcc7a1ffd248c22a747a1ddc7863d2b386d409a
(cherry picked from commit 65386c91910ee03d947c2b8bcc226a53c30e060a)

commit_message:
VMware: Take the volume size from the user input

When we create a volume from an image or a snapshot, we need to
take the size of the volume from the user input and validate whether
the size is appropriate instead of taking the image size as the
volume size directly.

Change-Id: I7e3f40559b3055f08a7f6dcf041458165ff8032b
Closes-Bug: #1237557

commit_message:
VMware: Take the volume size from the user input

When we create a volume from an image or a snapshot, we need to
take the size of the volume from the user input and validate whether
the size is appropriate instead of taking the image size as the
volume size directly.

Change-Id: I3ea6dee0a1688e5038a05337b295c699f81267d1
Closes-Bug: #1237557

commit_message:
Fix negative unit test for sec group rules

Ensure the test fails because the security group
rule could not be created, and not because the security
group was deleted before creating the rule.

subject: Move driver initialization check into the method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 1207, 'name': 'Duncan Thomas', 'email': 'duncan.thomas@gmail.com', 'username': 'duncan-thomas'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-01-14 19:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/backup/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/create_volume/__init__.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'message': "Move driver initialization check into the method

Volumes and backups managers' methods are decorated with
`require_initialized_driver` which checks whether the driver has been
initialized or not. The decorator fails with a `DriverNotInitialized`
exception if the driver hasn't been initialized.

This early failure leaves volumes and backups in a wrong status which is
not just confusing for the user but it also makes it difficult to do
anything with the resources after they've been left in a 'bogus' status.

For example, when a volume creation is requested, the volume is first
created in the database and its status is set to 'creating'. Then the
scheduler will pick an available volume node and send the task to it. If
the driver has not been initialized, the volume status will be left as
'creating' instead of 'error'.

This patch fixes that issue by moving the driver initialization check
into the various manager's methods. In some cases this check is done at
the very beginning of the method, in some others - either to avoid code
duplication or because the lines above the check made sense to be
executed first - this check is done later in the method.

Change-Id: I2610be6ba1aa7df417f1a1f7bb27af30273e4814
Closes-bug: #1242942
"}]
commit_message:
Move driver initialization check into the method

Volumes and backups managers' methods are decorated with
`require_initialized_driver` which checks whether the driver has been
initialized or not. The decorator fails with a `DriverNotInitialized`
exception if the driver hasn't been initialized.

This early failure leaves volumes and backups in a wrong status which is
not just confusing for the user but it also makes it difficult to do
anything with the resources after they've been left in a 'bogus' status.

For example, when a volume creation is requested, the volume is first
created in the database and its status is set to 'creating'. Then the
scheduler will pick an available volume node and send the task to it. If
the driver has not been initialized, the volume status will be left as
'creating' instead of 'error'.

This patch fixes that issue by moving the driver initialization check
into the various manager's methods. In some cases this check is done at
the very beginning of the method, in some others - either to avoid code
duplication or because the lines above the check made sense to be
executed first - this check is done later in the method.

Change-Id: I2610be6ba1aa7df417f1a1f7bb27af30273e4814
Closes-bug: #1242942

commit_message:
reduce default token duration to one hour

- reduces number of active tokens that have to be persisted, especially
  where clients are needlessly regenerating tokens
- reduces the window of publishing token revocation events (you only
  have to publish events from the last hour)
- reduces the window of the token revocation list (similar to the above)

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Implements: bp reduce-default-token-duration
Change-Id: Ia548f7e981690edab56c51fdcab9102245aced3e

subject: Fix incorrect redirection when staging SSH files.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 7850, 'name': 'Kevin Conway', 'email': 'kevinjacobconway@gmail.com', 'username': 'kevinconway'}, {'_account_id': 8136, 'name': 'Viswa Vutharkar', 'email': 'vpvutharkar@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'vvutharkar'}, {'_account_id': 8214, 'name': 'Auston McReynolds', 'email': 'amcreynolds@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'amcreynolds'}, {'_account_id': 9683, 'name': 'Mat Lowery', 'email': 'mlowery@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'mat-lowery'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-06 21:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/extra-data.d/62-ssh-key', 'scripts/files/elements/fedora-guest/extra-data.d/62-ssh-key'], 'message': 'Fix incorrect redirection when staging SSH files.

Existing code uses sudo and cat with redirection to stage SSH files
(e.g. id_rsa). But the redirection redirects the output of the sudo
command as well as the cat command. Thus, any stdout from the
interactive shell (e.g. .bashrc) can end up in the staged files.
Remove the redirection and use dd instead (as is used to copy
staged files to their final destination).

Closes-Bug: #1266557
Change-Id: Ia976bc309a282e4917e89afca52b6986bab26f07
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect redirection when staging SSH files.

Existing code uses sudo and cat with redirection to stage SSH files
(e.g. id_rsa). But the redirection redirects the output of the sudo
command as well as the cat command. Thus, any stdout from the
interactive shell (e.g. .bashrc) can end up in the staged files.
Remove the redirection and use dd instead (as is used to copy
staged files to their final destination).

Closes-Bug: #1266557
Change-Id: Ia976bc309a282e4917e89afca52b6986bab26f07

subject: Fix incorrect assertTrue usage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-13 10:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_projects.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/utils.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_groups.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v3/test_users.py'], 'message': "Fix incorrect assertTrue usage

Several self.assertTrue(len(returned_list)) statements exist,
which don't make any sense as we're testing an integer length
as a boolean.  Instead test the returned list length matches
the list passed in to stub the request.

Change-Id: I713c3a6afcc93ebb2a8f7ffde45aade2154ebf2c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect assertTrue usage

Several self.assertTrue(len(returned_list)) statements exist,
which don't make any sense as we're testing an integer length
as a boolean.  Instead test the returned list length matches
the list passed in to stub the request.

Change-Id: I713c3a6afcc93ebb2a8f7ffde45aade2154ebf2c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 21:54:30.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/pre-install.d/00-disable-apt-recommends', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-guest/pre-install.d/04-baseline-tools'], 'message': 'Fix error installing language pack in Guest Image

    A script in the element for ubuntu-guest does not appear to be
    running the apt-get update command.  02-baseline-tools had a
    package which no longer matches the default name which is part of
    the base image.  I removed the apt-get update which was not working
    and deferred to the call in 03-baseline-tools.  I then moved our
    02-baseline-tools to 04-baseline-tools so that it runs after 03

Change-Id: I1a9ad225f9a2e0fa976be02180dbbe5e24c3bdea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error installing language pack in Guest Image

    A script in the element for ubuntu-guest does not appear to be
    running the apt-get update command.  02-baseline-tools had a
    package which no longer matches the default name which is part of
    the base image.  I removed the apt-get update which was not working
    and deferred to the call in 03-baseline-tools.  I then moved our
    02-baseline-tools to 04-baseline-tools so that it runs after 03

Change-Id: I1a9ad225f9a2e0fa976be02180dbbe5e24c3bdea

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6966, 'name': 'Jeffrey J. Walls', 'email': 'jeff.walls@hpe.com', 'username': 'ftcjeff'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 17:53:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ramdisk/extra-data.d/scripts/d/init-func'], 'message': 'Wait for tgtd socket to be available

tgtd returns execution control and backgrounds itself almost immediately
and before it has made it's listening socket available. This can cause a
race condition as the tgtd socket is not available when tgtadm is run,
resulting in an error:

failed to send request hdr to tgt daemon

Add a function to check if the socket is available before moving on to
calling tgtadm, and a wait_for helper function we can use.  We'll
check for the socket every 0.5 seconds, for up to 5 seconds.

I'm seeing this issue on almost every deploy using a ramdisk built from
Fedora 20. I'm not sure if something has changed in tgtd, but this
behavior is documented since Fedora 18 at least. In the systemd script
for tgtd, there is actually "sleep 5" to work around the problem.

See Also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=848942

Change-Id: Iffa9fc63393309ca653d592dff17316ecbea3e09
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for tgtd socket to be available

tgtd returns execution control and backgrounds itself almost immediately
and before it has made it's listening socket available. This can cause a
race condition as the tgtd socket is not available when tgtadm is run,
resulting in an error:

failed to send request hdr to tgt daemon

Add a function to check if the socket is available before moving on to
calling tgtadm, and a wait_for helper function we can use.  We'll
check for the socket every 0.5 seconds, for up to 5 seconds.

I'm seeing this issue on almost every deploy using a ramdisk built from
Fedora 20. I'm not sure if something has changed in tgtd, but this
behavior is documented since Fedora 18 at least. In the systemd script
for tgtd, there is actually "sleep 5" to work around the problem.

See Also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=848942

Change-Id: Iffa9fc63393309ca653d592dff17316ecbea3e09

commit_message:
Create only necessary resources for compute v2 and network tests

This patch leverages the set_network_resources method in order to allow
tempest api tests for compute v2 and network to create only those
network resources which are required by the test

Related-Bug: #1262334

Change-Id: I89d4aead38a68c9222c5b0cd5dd0386705eb9648

subject: Change libvirt log level from debug to info+
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 16:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt'], 'message': 'Change libvirt log level from debug to info+

Commit eb68676e460834831b0b72348f9e016b3341f3aa changed the log
level for libvirt to debug, but no useful information is given
at debug level.

Devstack makes the system logs unusable for a typical developer
workstation with the current log_level of DEBUG.  Hopefully INFO
is a reasonable middle ground.

Change-Id: I576b37f24ca0cb3da2d6dae234ac90815944fda2
'}]
commit_message:
Change libvirt log level from debug to info+

Commit eb68676e460834831b0b72348f9e016b3341f3aa changed the log
level for libvirt to debug, but no useful information is given
at debug level.

Devstack makes the system logs unusable for a typical developer
workstation with the current log_level of DEBUG.  Hopefully INFO
is a reasonable middle ground.

Change-Id: I576b37f24ca0cb3da2d6dae234ac90815944fda2

Add openstack.common.uuidutils to Solum

oslo-incubator for working with uuid. This patch adds
uuidutils to openstack.comon forlder in Solum folder.

commit_message:
Support inexact filtering on attributes

Being able to specify inexact filters on attributes is an important
part of ensuring the size of collections returned by list API calls
is minimized

DocImpact

Partially implements bp filtering-backend-support

Change-Id: If81f6644217f121afeed00b867f369ec257e63b3

commit_message:
Test server create with ephemeral disk

This patch creates new flavor, which includes ephemeral disk.
Then ssh into the instance to get partition information. We can't
get partition device name , this depends on image. So we compare
the number of partitions to confirm ephemeral disk is created.

Change-Id: I3183746cf35b2acbf443a0b52b211982758bcf87

commit_message:
Make use of REST client from tempest project

1. run_tests.sh: Add tempest source tree to PYTHONPATH before running tests.

2. Adjust tests to use tempest client.

3. Enable authentication in devstack solum service.

For this to work, tempest must be installed. Patch [1] is submitted for the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/64062
