During live migration, after instance migrated to destination, we
call Hypervisor destroy to clean the instance, this can be omitted
because it doesn't exist in source server already. This patch changes
cleanup to a public method to driver, split instance destroy to two
step:

1. destroy instance in the Hypervisor
2. cleanup instance resources(block device, network)

Change-Id: I65e711c03fee7342b1e2bc4f9459baae7729f911
Closes-bug: 1240820
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize libvirt live migration workflow at source

During live migration, after instance migrated to destination, we
call Hypervisor destroy to clean the instance, this can be omitted
because it doesn't exist in source server already. This patch changes
cleanup to a public method to driver, split instance destroy to two
step:

1. destroy instance in the Hypervisor
2. cleanup instance resources(block device, network)

Change-Id: I65e711c03fee7342b1e2bc4f9459baae7729f911
Closes-bug: 1240820

commit_message:

 - MeteringRule

resources: metering-label and metering-label-rule.

commit_message:
Run neutron-debug with admin tenant in neutron-adv-test

Because neutron-debug create-probe needs admin role only, demo tenants
cannot create ports. neutron-debug is wrapped in order to run it only
with admin tenant.

Change-Id: Ib65e8639858c597345c6a5fdc0192b40f34a0300
Closes-Bug: #1269090

revisions:

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that
will accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password.

Interim commit that keeps the service,db and user functions in order to
merge other changes.

Change-Id: Iba4a611b387d0975e8a23cc758d2ac7dec8210ad
Partial-Bug: #1195915
'}]
commit_message:
Move to use "get_password" instead of "{user,service,db}_password"

The user_password, service_password and db_password functions are redundant
since they simply call "secret". Creates a get_password function that
will accept a "type" of db, service or user.

All instances of these calls have been changed to call get_password.

Interim commit that keeps the service,db and user functions in order to
merge other changes.

Change-Id: Iba4a611b387d0975e8a23cc758d2ac7dec8210ad
Partial-Bug: #1195915

subject: Don't install scripts straight to /usr/local/bin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 16:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['elements/openstack-clients/install.d/51-openstack-clients'], 'message': "Don't install scripts straight to /usr/local/bin

This results in more then just the openstack clients getting installed
to /usr/local/bin. In my case /usr/local/bin/pip was part of the
python-novaclient virtualenv and being used globally. Instead link to
what we want inside the virtualenv.

Change-Id: If44b397cdd80c46bf5a2a86d7369a4d74e09b58c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install scripts straight to /usr/local/bin

This results in more then just the openstack clients getting installed
to /usr/local/bin. In my case /usr/local/bin/pip was part of the
python-novaclient virtualenv and being used globally. Instead link to
what we want inside the virtualenv.

Change-Id: If44b397cdd80c46bf5a2a86d7369a4d74e09b58c

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2014-01-13 11:15:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/cache/cache.py', 'openstack/common/cache/__init__.py', 'tests/unit/cache/__init__.py', 'openstack/common/cache/_backends/memory.py', 'tests/unit/cache/base.py', 'tests/unit/cache/test_memory.py', 'openstack/common/cache/backends.py', 'openstack/common/cache/_backends/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tests/unit/cache/test_cache.py'], 'message': "Implement cache abstraction layer

This patch implements a cache abstraction library that can be extended
and supports multiple back-ends.

The patch being submitted defines the library's API and implements a
first in-memory back-end, which is the default one and can be used for
development purposes.

Configuration variables
=======================

The library introduces 1 optional configuration variable:

    * cache_url: The cache url. For example:
        memory://?default_ttl=2

`cache.register_oslo_config` needs to be called explicitly with a
ConfigOpts instance in order to register this parameter. The library can
be used without oslo.config.

Installing back-ends
====================

Back-ends are loaded using stevedore, which means, they most be
installed as entry_points under the `openstack.common.cache.backends`
namespace. See `setup.cfg`.

NOTE: Some of the ideas where taken from Django's cache library and others
from Oslo's memcached module.

Implements blueprint cache-backend-abstraction

Change-Id: Ic2a84ecef949fb28a7d05fe1b2c54ca91da3983c
"}]
commit_message:
Implement cache abstraction layer

This patch implements a cache abstraction library that can be extended
and supports multiple back-ends.

The patch being submitted defines the library's API and implements a
first in-memory back-end, which is the default one and can be used for
development purposes.

Configuration variables
=======================

The library introduces 1 optional configuration variable:

    * cache_url: The cache url. For example:
        memory://?default_ttl=2

`cache.register_oslo_config` needs to be called explicitly with a
ConfigOpts instance in order to register this parameter. The library can
be used without oslo.config.

Installing back-ends
====================

Back-ends are loaded using stevedore, which means, they most be
installed as entry_points under the `openstack.common.cache.backends`
namespace. See `setup.cfg`.

NOTE: Some of the ideas where taken from Django's cache library and others
from Oslo's memcached module.

Implements blueprint cache-backend-abstraction

Change-Id: Ic2a84ecef949fb28a7d05fe1b2c54ca91da3983c

commit_message:
WIP: Integrate Solum CLI into python-openstackclient

This integrates Devdatta's assembly show command into the OSC.

Since Solum is not an official OpenStack project, we may not integrate the
Solum features needed into the OpenStack Client (OSC) itself.  Thus, we must
indicate that the OSC is a requirement and make a Solum plugin.

Implements: blueprint solum-minimal-cli
Change-Id: I4b31d088dfca9436698c64127d2ce006cab9e367

subject: explicitly set rpc_backend in cinder.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-15 16:15:38.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/cinder_common_spec.rb', 'templates/default/cinder.conf.erb'], 'message': "explicitly set rpc_backend in cinder.conf

Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-block
Fixes: bug #1269432

The following is a default value in cinder:

rpc_backend=cinder.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu

Using RDO (rhel/centos) packages, this gets overridden in
/usr/share/nova/cinder-dist.conf to 'impl_qpid'.

In order to cleanly set this back to the default value (which is what we
want as a default in the cookbooks), we need to explicitly set this in
cinder.conf

Change-Id: I5bd0c6ed95a6d02202b19708f15a58ec43a2fe6c
"}]
commit_message:
explicitly set rpc_backend in cinder.conf

Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-block
Fixes: bug #1269432

The following is a default value in cinder:

rpc_backend=cinder.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu

Using RDO (rhel/centos) packages, this gets overridden in
/usr/share/nova/cinder-dist.conf to 'impl_qpid'.

In order to cleanly set this back to the default value (which is what we
want as a default in the cookbooks), we need to explicitly set this in
cinder.conf

Change-Id: I5bd0c6ed95a6d02202b19708f15a58ec43a2fe6c

commit_message:
Close SSH connections in Cloud Servers resource

Previously, it was possible that a failed stack or hung script could
cause an SSH connection to remain open.  This ensures that the SSH
connections are always closed.

Closes-Bug: #1267173
Change-Id: Ie31ddb8370349ad67c7f63916e6b3b202904da23

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-09 08:01:59.000000000', 'files': ['bin/heat-keystone-setup'], 'message': 'Fix heat-keystone-setup error when try to create heat user

Unset OS_SERVICE_TOKEN and OS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT temporarily to make
sure this command can run even if the OS_SERVICE_TOKEN and
OS_SERVICE_ENDPOIN exist in shell environment.
Remove die_if_not_set in get_data function, because there maybe no
data in get_data function, for example, if the heat user does not
exist, the die_if_not_set will be in error.
Remove die_if_not_set after keystone user-list for the same reason.

Change-Id: I132f975ac2da21e6ad7431ae326ad9bd538e4696
Closes-Bug: #1266670
'}]
commit_message:
Fix heat-keystone-setup error when try to create heat user

Unset OS_SERVICE_TOKEN and OS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT temporarily to make
sure this command can run even if the OS_SERVICE_TOKEN and
OS_SERVICE_ENDPOIN exist in shell environment.
Remove die_if_not_set in get_data function, because there maybe no
data in get_data function, for example, if the heat user does not
exist, the die_if_not_set will be in error.
Remove die_if_not_set after keystone user-list for the same reason.

Change-Id: I132f975ac2da21e6ad7431ae326ad9bd538e4696
Closes-Bug: #1266670

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-14 16:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_tasks.py', 'glance/api/v2/tasks.py', 'glance/tests/integration/v2/test_tasks_api.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_tasks_resource.py'], 'message': "Makes 'expires_at' not appear if not set on task

fails on a task. Before the task has finished, there shouldn't be any
'expires_at' set on the task. This change fixes the ResponseSerializer

Change-Id: I9880cc03b9d6f0dd98388fcf0d1bdc9c34dd6c0e

commit_message:
Makes 'expires_at' not appear if not set on task

Fixes bug: 1267148

'expires_at' on a task must be set only after the executor succeeds or
fails on a task. Before the task has finished, there shouldn't be any
'expires_at' set on the task. This change fixes the ResponseSerializer
to not show 'expires_at' if it is not set.

commit_message:
API worker architecture

-Introduced a handler class for encapsulating future DB layer work.
-Renamed solum/api/handlers/handler.py method put to update.
-Renamed solum/api/handlers/handler.py method post to create.
-Fixed tests to check for new status codes.
-Refactored a few commenets to use OpenStack recommended way.

Change-Id: I38fc94ff4cf6c1eb43f917b4fb2ed971929ddbf1

commit_message:
FloatingIP PTR record functionality

* Central methods update_floatingip, get_floatingip, list_floatingip
* API according to
* https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Designate/Blueprints/Reverse
* Put network functionanlity into a pluggable api class (In case we want
* more)

blueprint floating-ip-ptrs

Change-Id: Ic9194e5bcfc8d25126b9e84652144f58cddcccfe

commit_message:
Turn block_device_mapping.volume_size to int

It was a string before, while it by its meaning should be an integer.
This change is backward compatible, as it still accepts string values.

Change-Id: I950bfbb1250f6aa63e9b20831cd92f1c9b974db2
Closes-Bug: #1267889

subject: Remove requested_project_id from oauth authorization parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-06 23:15:26.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_v3_oauth1.py', 'keystone/contrib/oauth1/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Remove requested_project_id from oauth authorization parameters

This change will remove the requested_project_id from being
included in the verification of the oauth signature when
issuing a request token.

The requested_project_id will still be required as a header,
when attempting to create a request token. But it should not be
included with the oauth specific headers.

Change-Id: I819a29119a359873633ab8fde553a11a8a37a682
'}]
commit_message:
Remove requested_project_id from oauth authorization parameters

This change will remove the requested_project_id from being
included in the verification of the oauth signature when
issuing a request token.

The requested_project_id will still be required as a header,
when attempting to create a request token. But it should not be
included with the oauth specific headers.

Change-Id: I819a29119a359873633ab8fde553a11a8a37a682

subject: explicitly set rpc_backend in nova.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-15 13:37:57.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/nova-common_spec.rb', 'templates/default/nova.conf.erb'], 'message': "explicitly set rpc_backend in nova.conf

Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-compute
Fixes: bug #1269077

The following is a default value in openstack:

rpc_backend=nova.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu

Using RDO (rhel/centos) packages, this gets overridden in
/usr/share/nova/nova-dist.conf to 'impl_qpid'.

In order to cleanly set this back to the default value (which is what we
want as a default in the cookbooks), we need to explicitly set this in
nova.conf.

Change-Id: Idd025034c07ce12810a38eff87975b1c8caf1985
"}]
commit_message:
explicitly set rpc_backend in nova.conf

Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-for-compute
Fixes: bug #1269077

The following is a default value in openstack:

rpc_backend=nova.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu

Using RDO (rhel/centos) packages, this gets overridden in
/usr/share/nova/nova-dist.conf to 'impl_qpid'.

In order to cleanly set this back to the default value (which is what we
want as a default in the cookbooks), we need to explicitly set this in
nova.conf.

Change-Id: Idd025034c07ce12810a38eff87975b1c8caf1985

subject: Fix incorrect capitalization in ceilometer install
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-15 15:42:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': "Fix incorrect capitalization in ceilometer install

According to the Conventions document, Ceilometer's official name is

'Telemetry service' in install guide.

This patch only fixes the section_ceilometer-install.xml to make it
easier to review.

Change-Id: I1615c16660700dedd0be1eb460b83839142829be

commit_message:
Fix incorrect capitalization in ceilometer install

According to the Conventions document, Ceilometer's official name is
OpenStack Telemetry, so the 'Telemetry Service' should be changed to
'Telemetry service' in install guide.

This patch only fixes the section_ceilometer-install.xml to make it
easier to review.

Change-Id: I1615c16660700dedd0be1eb460b83839142829be
ref: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions#Service_and_project_names

subject: Add service_credentials for ceilometer-agent-central
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-15 11:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': "Add service_credentials for ceilometer-agent-central

ceilometer-agent-central will run interval_task which needs
basic config of service_credentials. However, current guide doesn't
provide such setting, so the task will fail and raise Unauthorized
exception.

This patch fixes this problem by adding sample config of
service_credentials section.

NOTE: This patch also fixes some content overflow problem in related
part.

Change-Id: I38b1d417c3aa1d7b31006045c01bc6cf759ed6d0
Closes-Bug: #1268866
(cherry picked from commit 93688b5133fcd003eeb046d5dfafebbc86ee5adb)
"}]
commit_message:
Add service_credentials for ceilometer-agent-central

ceilometer-agent-central will run interval_task which needs
basic config of service_credentials. However, current guide doesn't
provide such setting, so the task will fail and raise Unauthorized
exception.

This patch fixes this problem by adding sample config of
service_credentials section.

NOTE: This patch also fixes some content overflow problem in related
part.

Change-Id: I38b1d417c3aa1d7b31006045c01bc6cf759ed6d0
Closes-Bug: #1268866
(cherry picked from commit 93688b5133fcd003eeb046d5dfafebbc86ee5adb)

commit_message:
Upgrade cinder rootwrap config on upgrade

Upgrade cinder rootwrap config on havana to icehouse upgrade, so that it
switches to using oslo-rootwrap instead. This follows the model used by
Nova in previous upgrades.

Requires that configure_cinder_rootwrap() is available in devstack, so
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65946 must land first.

Change-Id: Iccb262ac2005efdfb509edee7c967801d8fb0c65

commit_message:
Clarify usage of an endpoint

Some debris were removed in this patch. The debris have been lost when
OSFT verification test was removed. This patch involves a clear endpoint
that represents an installation of OpenStack cluster. The current
format of an endpoint looks like that:

{
    "auth_url": "http://example.com:5000/v2.0",
    "username": "admin",
    "password": "secret",
    "tenant_name": "demo"
}

Each deploy engine should to return an endpoint as a result of
make_deploy method.

TODO: We can instantiate rally.osclients.Clients more simply such as
Clients(**endpoint).

Change-Id: Id5217714d08135b935e4594f931e04c7f04861c5

commit_message:
Enable $pybasedir value in pxe.py

We should not refer $pybasedir directly in our python code, because
it is loaded by paths.py, we should use paths.basedir_def("") to load
this $pybasedir value as a base path.

And change some 'nova' words to 'ironic in paths.py

Change-Id: I4c6bcb103d4d1eee8e7bf78f46c815630666cfe9
Closes-Bug: #1267351

subject: Add new neutron-ovs-cleanup element.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-13 20:03:14.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-ovs-cleanup/element-deps', 'elements/neutron-ovs-cleanup/install.d/81-neutron-ovs-cleanup', 'elements/neutron-ovs-cleanup/install.d/neutron-ovs-cleanup.service', 'elements/neutron-ovs-cleanup/README.md', 'elements/neutron-ovs-cleanup/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/81-neutron-ovs-cleanup'], 'message': 'Add new neutron-ovs-cleanup element.

This patch adds a new neutron-ovs-cleanup element which
configures the neutron-ovs-cleanup service to run
so that it cleans up *all* OVS ports. We want to do this
at a very specific time in the boot process so that DHCP
on reboot works properly:

 1) after OVS is available (nonetworking)
 2) before networking is started

NOTE: This service is not started on first boot but will
run on any subsequent reboots (it is enabled in os-refresh-config)

Without this fix networking after rebooting an overcloud instance
is a total failure due to the fact that the physical NIC has been
moved to an OVS bridge by init-neutron-ovs and DHCP requests
fail.

The currently patch implements this on systemd only.

In addition to all the above, cleaning up old neutron ports is
a good idea on reboot anyways. So we get that for free here too.

Change-Id: Ic87f2388680ec4f67b6275b8d923f76b75559c78
Closes-bug: 1254533
'}]
commit_message:
Add new neutron-ovs-cleanup element.

This patch adds a new neutron-ovs-cleanup element which
configures the neutron-ovs-cleanup service to run
so that it cleans up *all* OVS ports. We want to do this
at a very specific time in the boot process so that DHCP
on reboot works properly:

 1) after OVS is available (nonetworking)
 2) before networking is started

NOTE: This service is not started on first boot but will
run on any subsequent reboots (it is enabled in os-refresh-config)

Without this fix networking after rebooting an overcloud instance
is a total failure due to the fact that the physical NIC has been
moved to an OVS bridge by init-neutron-ovs and DHCP requests
fail.

The currently patch implements this on systemd only.

In addition to all the above, cleaning up old neutron ports is
a good idea on reboot anyways. So we get that for free here too.

Change-Id: Ic87f2388680ec4f67b6275b8d923f76b75559c78
Closes-bug: 1254533

commit_message:
Network manager refactoring

Part 3.

1. Some cleaning in network manager.
2. A number of network manager tests added.
3. Some refactoring in NetworkConfigurationValidator and NetworkConfigurationVerifyHandlers.
4. Unification of network groups creation and of networks update.
5. Global parameters removed.

Implements: blueprint nailgun-network-manager-refactoring

commit_message:
Use ironic.common.paths to get the templates paths

Instead of using the $pybasedir directly to get the pxe_config_template
and net_config_template options, this patch makes use of the
basedir_path() method from the ironic.common.paths modules to get the
uninterpolated paths relative to $pybasedir.

Change-Id: Ia940b4b46e743e03f0e5b957a247ded1bd9d68b7
Closes-Bug: #1269384

subject: LBaaS: synchronize haproxy deploy/undeploy_instance methods
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 2711, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'display_name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'joshua.zhang@canonical.com', 'username': 'zhhuabj'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 6316, 'name': 'Anita Kuno', 'email': 'anteaya@anteaya.info', 'username': 'anteaya'}, {'_account_id': 7317, 'name': 'Bo Lin', 'email': 'linb@vmware.com', 'username': 'berlin'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-13 15:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py'], 'message': 'LBaaS: synchronize haproxy deploy/undeploy_instance methods

When creating/deleting lbaas objects at a high rate (like tempest api tests do)
deploy/undeploy_unstance methods of haproxy namespace driver
may be executed concurrently which leads to different conflicts with
network namespaces and interfaces created by the diver.

@synchronized decorator should be used in order to ensure that only one thread
will execute one of the methods at a time.

Closes-Bug: #1260692

Change-Id: Ibe86653c20c9a4e0b4e7b3b2cefbd445428b82da
'}]
commit_message:
LBaaS: synchronize haproxy deploy/undeploy_instance methods

When creating/deleting lbaas objects at a high rate (like tempest api tests do)
deploy/undeploy_unstance methods of haproxy namespace driver
may be executed concurrently which leads to different conflicts with
network namespaces and interfaces created by the diver.

@synchronized decorator should be used in order to ensure that only one thread
will execute one of the methods at a time.

Closes-Bug: #1260692

Change-Id: Ibe86653c20c9a4e0b4e7b3b2cefbd445428b82da

Closes-Bug: #1269198

commit_message:
Restart nova-compute after modify the config file

The Install the Compute agent for the Telemetry service section of
install-guide doesn't restart the nova-compute service after modify
/etc/nova/nova.conf file, so the configured option will not take
effect timely.

Change-Id: I8b4a14333c0d8d6e0a2633e7c3cf0997d2e46009
Closes-Bug: #1269198

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-10 14:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_resources_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': "Replace mongo aggregation with plain ol' map-reduce

Fixes bug 1262571

Previously, the mongodb storage driver an aggregation pipeline
over the meter collection in order to construct a list of resources
adorned with first & last sample timestamps etc.

However mongodb aggregation framework performs sorting in-memory,
in this case operating over a potentially very large collection.
It is also hardcoded to abort any sorts in an aggregation pipeline
that will consume more than 10% of physical memory, which is
observed in this case.

Now, we avoid the aggregation framework altogether and instead
use an equivalent map-reduce.

Change-Id: Ibef4a95acada411af385ff75ccb36c5724068b59
"}]
commit_message:
Replace mongo aggregation with plain ol' map-reduce

Fixes bug 1262571

Previously, the mongodb storage driver an aggregation pipeline
over the meter collection in order to construct a list of resources
adorned with first & last sample timestamps etc.

However mongodb aggregation framework performs sorting in-memory,
in this case operating over a potentially very large collection.
It is also hardcoded to abort any sorts in an aggregation pipeline
that will consume more than 10% of physical memory, which is
observed in this case.

Now, we avoid the aggregation framework altogether and instead
use an equivalent map-reduce.

Change-Id: Ibef4a95acada411af385ff75ccb36c5724068b59

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 09:00:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-install.xml'], 'message': "Add service_credentials for ceilometer-agent-central

NOTE: This patch also fixes some content overflow problem in related

Change-Id: I38b1d417c3aa1d7b31006045c01bc6cf759ed6d0
Closes-Bug: #1268866

commit_message:
Add service_credentials for ceilometer-agent-central

ceilometer-agent-central will run interval_task which needs
basic config of service_credentials. However, current guide doesn't
provide such setting, so the task will fail and raise Unauthorized
exception.

This patch fixes this problem by adding sample config of
service_credentials section.

NOTE: This patch also fixes some content overflow problem in related
part.

Change-Id: I38b1d417c3aa1d7b31006045c01bc6cf759ed6d0
Closes-Bug: #1268866

commit_message:
Add a note for ceilometer log_dir on Ubuntu

Currently, Ceilometer services on Ubuntu Precise have not been
launched with log_dir option, all the services except ceilometer-api
cannot generate their log files.

This patch adds a note for the log_dir option in case of such problem.

Change-Id: I324093df38854ca01038c99dad148bbca4c09e71
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1268541

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-13 11:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'heatclient/tests/test_resources.py', 'heatclient/v1/resources.py'], 'message': "Add to_dict() method to Resource class

Commit a07b8b0b introduces a regression when running 'heat
resource-show' command because heatclient.v1.resources.Resource class
didn't implement the to_dict() method.

This commit adds unit tests for resource show and list commands. It
also removes the use of MagicMock in these tests because it introduced
a recursion issue (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65269/).

commit_message:
Add to_dict() method to Resource class

Commit a07b8b0b introduces a regression when running 'heat
resource-show' command because heatclient.v1.resources.Resource class
didn't implement the to_dict() method.

This commit adds unit tests for resource show and list commands. It
also removes the use of MagicMock in these tests because it introduced
a recursion issue (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65269/).

Change-Id: I6c4c0e293d2955c67a0240136faa2721ef2e4ffa
Closes-Bug: 1266678

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-08 01:50:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Change log from ERROR to WARNING when instance absent

Periodic task will update the host stat so that it will
collect all active instances and get their disk size
during the operation period, the instance might be resized
by nova operations, it will lead to disk file not exist
it's not an error from current design point of view, so
change from ERROR to WARNING to avoid confusion

Change-Id: I3b6f1416c248d9d4d2caaf2cc30a7c944685661c
Closes-Bug: #1243849
"}]
commit_message:
Change log from ERROR to WARNING when instance absent

Periodic task will update the host stat so that it will
collect all active instances and get their disk size
during the operation period, the instance might be resized
by nova operations, it will lead to disk file not exist
it's not an error from current design point of view, so
change from ERROR to WARNING to avoid confusion

Change-Id: I3b6f1416c248d9d4d2caaf2cc30a7c944685661c
Closes-Bug: #1243849

commit_message:
provide infrastructure for publishing docs to html

this brings over the pbr infrastructure for publishing rst files
to html with the oslo.sphix style. We'll need to move around
and reformat some of the documents for them to fully take effect
but this would be the first step in getting there.

Updated with our latest knowledge on how to do the right tox.ini
changes to handle sphinx issues.

This will then get used by another publish job to go to some
online repository.

Change-Id: I0dd3ecf0a9b3e356a4a2980a305b421b7d7b8602

subject: Refresh openstack-tools virtualenv every time
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 23:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/setup-clienttools'], 'message': 'Refresh openstack-tools virtualenv every time

All of the commands there are idempotent. By not refreshing it, every
time we change this virtualenv initialization, such as the recent
addition of os-apply-config, we fail to build the virtualenv in the way
the rest of the code expects it to be built.

Change-Id: I07cefaf8348769cc7793936819175c1daaabd41b
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh openstack-tools virtualenv every time

All of the commands there are idempotent. By not refreshing it, every
time we change this virtualenv initialization, such as the recent
addition of os-apply-config, we fail to build the virtualenv in the way
the rest of the code expects it to be built.

Change-Id: I07cefaf8348769cc7793936819175c1daaabd41b

The os_command_line can now be presented to the Libvirt driver through the

the driver uses its value instead of the default. Libvirt uses this

commit_message:
Enabled Libvirt driver to read 'os_command_line' from image properties.

The os_command_line can now be presented to the Libvirt driver through the
glance image property 'os_command_line'.  When this property is present,
the driver uses its value instead of the default. Libvirt uses this
value as either kernel command line or arguments to init (in case of LXC).
DocImpact

bp: enable-libvirt-driver-to-read-kernel-command-line-from-glance-image
Change-Id: Iad53c687053bdb5469baad4331ea55f428c170b0

commit_message:
Add "ci_commands" ssh command filter

ci_commands is added to roots authorized_keys as
command="/usr/local/bin/ci_commands on the test hosts. And the
private key is being passed to the ci slaves. The slaves can now
use this key to ssh to the test environment and run a subset of
commands(filtered by ci_commands).

Change-Id: If08b81b8ff5ba6ce526406962e2c76097d141cf5
Co-Authored-by: Chris Jones <cmsj@tenshu.net>
Co-Authored-by: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

subject: Allow users to customize max header size
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-13 14:05:35.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/wsgi.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf'], 'message': 'Allow users to customize max header size

Also increases the default value from 8192 to 16384

The former max header (8192) is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Equivalent fixes have been proposed in other projects

Change-Id: Ic714166440e2aa08b619ab1e5e5e0cf3cea3e309
Closes-Bug: 1190149
'}]
commit_message:
Allow users to customize max header size

Also increases the default value from 8192 to 16384

The former max header (8192) is exceeded in the following scenario
- Auth tokens built with a keystone v3 API catalog
- A catalog with approximately 8 or more endpoints defined

Equivalent fixes have been proposed in other projects

Change-Id: Ic714166440e2aa08b619ab1e5e5e0cf3cea3e309
Closes-Bug: 1190149

subject: Fix bug 1268456 for novaclient
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-15 07:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/utils.py', 'novaclient/tests/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug 1268456 for novaclient

For perviously logic, if flavor id is
start with "0Number", int(name_or_id)
will convert it to "Number". If flavor
id "Number" exist in DB, it will show
up for query with "0Number".
This fix enter flavor search logic at
the beginning. Also add one more UT
for this function.

Fixes: bug 1268456

Change-Id: I979ffcabd3d095eed1458bfcf4d608f951c88339
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug 1268456 for novaclient

For perviously logic, if flavor id is
start with "0Number", int(name_or_id)
will convert it to "Number". If flavor
id "Number" exist in DB, it will show
up for query with "0Number".
This fix enter flavor search logic at
the beginning. Also add one more UT
for this function.

Fixes: bug 1268456

Change-Id: I979ffcabd3d095eed1458bfcf4d608f951c88339

commit_message:
Move testtools to test-requirements.txt

The devstack-gate job is updated [1] to install packages from
test-requirements.txt. Hence move testtools from requirements.txt to
test-requirements.txt.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/64226

Change-Id: Ic3d3f4663bff64be91c23d9af46a3f766cbb7cf5

commit_message:
Add quota usage support for V2 API

This is the client support for nova quota-detail API extension. With
this new nova quota-usage command, it is possible for user to view not
only quota resource "limit" value, but also "in_use" and "reserved"
values.

Implements blueprint expose-quota-details

Change-Id: I3b0387417bb4fed9cb61baca319f4496e31af117

subject: Changes path used for trove-guestagent.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-31 13:20:05.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/files/trove-guest.upstart.conf', 'scripts/files/trove-guest.systemd.conf'], 'message': 'Changes path used for trove-guestagent.conf

Reasons:
- Guest Agent uses trove-guestagent.conf.sample directly,
  which is not correct way to do it.
- Probably this was a workaround, because /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building up due to another Bug: 1265184 in trove.

Changes:
- Corrected the path of config file to be used as
  /etc/trove-guestagent.conf.

Dependency:
- This change would only pass the gate-tests
  when Bug: 1265184 gets resolved.

Change-Id: I25ff15fb16ee80f33e447ff83ffa760919646446
Closes-Bug: #1176102
'}]
commit_message:
Changes path used for trove-guestagent.conf

Reasons:
- Guest Agent uses trove-guestagent.conf.sample directly,
  which is not correct way to do it.
- Probably this was a workaround, because /etc/trove-guestagent.conf
  was not building up due to another Bug: 1265184 in trove.

Changes:
- Corrected the path of config file to be used as
  /etc/trove-guestagent.conf.

Dependency:
- This change would only pass the gate-tests
  when Bug: 1265184 gets resolved.

Change-Id: I25ff15fb16ee80f33e447ff83ffa760919646446
Closes-Bug: #1176102

commit_message:
Fix controller howto for Debian

Many parts of the install-guide for the nova controler node
and compute node must be removed in Debian, since that's
handled by Debconf. It is more confusing than anything else.
So this patch hides some steps from the Debian install-guide.

Change-Id: I374cf3fb3103b49c60f28648e1f7a16dfe274387

commit_message:
Adding support for extra_specs (key:value pairs)

After changing compute_capabilities_filter from RPC to DB,
instance_type_extra_specs doesn't work at all.
This bug is fixed by adding extra_specs column into compute_nodes
and comparing each key:value pair between flavor_extra_specs
in nova.conf and flavor-key.

Change-Id: I558c42e1be1fb58c9c23fdfb056de472be84c26b
Closes-Bug: #1245541
Co-authored-by: David Kang <dkang@isi.edu>

commit_message:
Added tenant_id property to OS::Neutron::Router

Now a router could be created passing the ID of the tenant which will
own the router. Only administrative users can set the tenant
identifier.

Some test were added to ensure that tenant_id is handled properly, and
some of the existing test were reorganized in different classes.

Change-Id: If47f89577673a98c0b6332db3a16a829f667c574
Closes-Bug: #1246629

subject: l3_agent: use spawn instead of spawn_n in _process_routers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-27 04:30:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'l3_agent: use spawn instead of spawn_n in _process_routers

spawn_n returns a greenlet object from which it is not possible to
retrieve either a return value or whether it raised any exceptions.
spawn returns a GreenThread object which you can use to get the
results of the call. In order to let the caller know the failure of
processing router(s), we should use spawn insead of spawn_n.

Added a new exception named ProcessRoutersError that is raised if
the spawned function fails.
Added related unit tests.

Change-Id: I15b732c97d52c74c15b08961bf01f6dca4e19a59
Closes-Bug: #1254984
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
'}]
commit_message:
l3_agent: use spawn instead of spawn_n in _process_routers

spawn_n returns a greenlet object from which it is not possible to
retrieve either a return value or whether it raised any exceptions.
spawn returns a GreenThread object which you can use to get the
results of the call. In order to let the caller know the failure of
processing router(s), we should use spawn insead of spawn_n.

Added a new exception named ProcessRoutersError that is raised if
the spawned function fails.
Added related unit tests.

Change-Id: I15b732c97d52c74c15b08961bf01f6dca4e19a59
Closes-Bug: #1254984
Co-Authored-By: Hirofumi Ichihara <ichihara.hirofumi@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Set SCSI as default disk bus on Power KVM

Overwrites the default KVM bus for disk and cdrom, IDE and virtio,
respectively. This check (after the get_disk_bus_for_device_type
call) keeps the current code flow for other archs and virt types.

Change-Id: I5098001180b3a87b4b5dfc84f9671d976c6248c6

subject: Change l3-agent to periodically check children are running
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-12-16 15:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/firewall/agents/varmour/varmour_router.py', 'etc/l3_agent.ini', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/test_vpn_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Change l3-agent to periodically check children are running

The l3-agent will now store info on the metadata-proxy process
it spawns, and use it to check if it's still running every time
_sync_routers_task() is called.  If it is not alive it will be
restarted.

A new flag, called 'check_child_processes', controls this behaviour.
Default value is False.

Closes-Bug: #1257775

Change-Id: Icc304db31b4a5cca292f52d82d3eb80383a54918
"}]
commit_message:
Change l3-agent to periodically check children are running

The l3-agent will now store info on the metadata-proxy process
it spawns, and use it to check if it's still running every time
_sync_routers_task() is called.  If it is not alive it will be
restarted.

A new flag, called 'check_child_processes', controls this behaviour.
Default value is False.

Closes-Bug: #1257775

Change-Id: Icc304db31b4a5cca292f52d82d3eb80383a54918

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-16 17:38:27.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/fake_rados.py', 'glance/common/exception.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py', 'glance/store/rbd.py'], 'message': 'Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image is
deleted when the underlying rbd image has a protected snapshot
because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the rbd image for async delete, allow the
glance delete to succeed and check on some future event
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able to
be deleted and attempt a cleanup.

Closes-bug: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes delete of protected rbd images

This fixes the scenario where an rbd-backed glance image is
deleted when the underlying rbd image has a protected snapshot
because a clone exists in cinder i.e. a volume that has been
created (cloned) from the image currently exists. The solution
here is to flag the rbd image for async delete, allow the
glance delete to succeed and check on some future event
(currently on subsequent deletes) whether the image is able to
be deleted and attempt a cleanup.

Closes-bug: bug 1185851
Change-Id: I3e0a08d392b90be6a544eeb841b7a1205b7c8cca

commit_message:
Except 404 for "detail" api call of deleted flavor

* Nova (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59860/) will not return details
  of deleted flavor for flavor detail api because deleted/non-deleted
  flavorid are not unique in DB, and duplicate flavor of same flavorid
  can be returned by flavor details api
* Fix the related tempest test to expect 404 for detail flavor api call
* Skip the test till Nova review gets in
  (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59860/)

Change-Id: I1695fb827d65feea119a76aac4c393b60b866a4e
Closes-Bug: #1153926

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-12-28 22:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-identity-api/v3/src/markdown/identity-api-v3-saml-profile-federation-ext.md'], 'message': 'The federation protocol profile for a remote SAML IdP (Federation pt3 B)

This profile describes how the SAML protocol should be supported.

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-12-19 02:56:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/__init__.py', 'requirements.txt', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/versions.py', 'nova/api/openstack/extensions.py'], 'message': "Add the ability to define API extensions using pecan

This is a potential approach I've considered for gradually moving the V3 API
to pecan.  Other newer projects tend to define their API declaratively with
pecan's object dispatch-style routing, but given Nova's large number of
extensions (and the fact that API routing is a composition of installed
packages with stevedore entrypoints), the more traditional approach would
probably involve a fundamental change in how the API is structured/composed.
Instead, this approach entails:

1.  Creating a pecan WSGI app that auto-discovers extensions written with pecan
2.  Overrides the /v3/ WSGI app's __call__ to attempt to route to the previous
    WSGI implementation *first*, falling back to the pecan implementation if no
    matching route is found
3.  Gradually rewriting extensions using pecan.  This patchset provides an
    implementation of the `version` endpoint.  When all extensions make
    use of pecan, the previous WSGI routing code is removed

Includes support for using our existing XML and ATOM serialization functions.

Implements: blueprint v3-api-pecan
Change-Id: I6f2b62228c4dcae704f5768bca2fbdac5afc54ee
"}]
commit_message:
Add the ability to define API extensions using pecan

This is a potential approach I've considered for gradually moving the V3 API
to pecan.  Other newer projects tend to define their API declaratively with
pecan's object dispatch-style routing, but given Nova's large number of
extensions (and the fact that API routing is a composition of installed
packages with stevedore entrypoints), the more traditional approach would
probably involve a fundamental change in how the API is structured/composed.
Instead, this approach entails:

1.  Creating a pecan WSGI app that auto-discovers extensions written with pecan
2.  Overrides the /v3/ WSGI app's __call__ to attempt to route to the previous
    WSGI implementation *first*, falling back to the pecan implementation if no
    matching route is found
3.  Gradually rewriting extensions using pecan.  This patchset provides an
    implementation of the `version` endpoint.  When all extensions make
    use of pecan, the previous WSGI routing code is removed

Includes support for using our existing XML and ATOM serialization functions.

Implements: blueprint v3-api-pecan
Change-Id: I6f2b62228c4dcae704f5768bca2fbdac5afc54ee

subject: Handle dict in object serialization
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-12-27 07:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Handle dict in object serialization

object doesn't handle dict serialization. For instance,
serializing {'foo': 123, 'obj': MyObj()} would cause an error.

The case will happen in filter_properties which is going to contain
instance type objects.
This patch is to add that support.

As remotable_classmethod() does, because deserialize_entity()
will convert primitives of Nova objects in 'updates' in
remotable() to real Nova objects, where 'updates' is also a
dict. We don't need to convert it again if a Nova object is
one of the fields.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I754bd33adc48cbd2279e0b914e9a3d399dca3c8a
"}]
commit_message:
Handle dict in object serialization

object doesn't handle dict serialization. For instance,
serializing {'foo': 123, 'obj': MyObj()} would cause an error.

The case will happen in filter_properties which is going to contain
instance type objects.
This patch is to add that support.

As remotable_classmethod() does, because deserialize_entity()
will convert primitives of Nova objects in 'updates' in
remotable() to real Nova objects, where 'updates' is also a
dict. We don't need to convert it again if a Nova object is
one of the fields.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: I754bd33adc48cbd2279e0b914e9a3d399dca3c8a

commit_message:
Only add ceilometer user to nova group if using compute agent

When using ceilometer outside of the compute context (ex: with the
swift middleware), puppet-ceilometer attempts to add the user to
the nova group which does not (and probably should not) exist on
the swift nodes.

Change-Id: I6cc68152325a967c024ce611f92a90ce0afba8cc
(cherry picked from commit d064997cd4c50d9b5365fe2ffca60e14a86b08e1)

commit_message:
Remove "Delete" buttons when VPN objects are in use

Deleting attached services and policies doesn't
cause NotImplementedError anymore. Moreover,
options "Delete VPN Service", "Delete IKE Policy" and
"Delete IPSec Policy" don't appear in corresponding row
if there is a connection created using these objects.
Some tests are added to detect such errors in future.

Fixes bug 1252330

Change-Id: I9ed1b4ecdad54b89bef45b2f5e422c30447cceb5

commit_message:
Adding testenv worker wrapper script

Adds a script 60-setup-testenvs which is run by os-refresh-config. On
first boot this carves up the host into a number of test environments
and starts a gearman worker for each environment, noop if run more
than once. Each test environment will have a seed, 3 vm's all on
their own bridge.

Depends-on: Ie33736850ec8186f0c90b82b6fbb0fd57fe47dc9
Change-Id: I46b2c95ccbda484b4de03585b830ac578df0e937

have the code in solum repository and invoke the same from devstack job.

subject: Exceptions cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 10:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/patterns/linear_flow.py', 'taskflow/patterns/unordered_flow.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_check_transition.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_flow_dependencies.py', 'taskflow/exceptions.py', 'taskflow/states.py', 'taskflow/utils/flow_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_flattening.py'], 'message': "Exceptions cleanup

Most TaskFlow exception don't have 'Exception' suffix in their names, so
we drop it from the few that have it, for sake of consistency and more
concise and expressive code.

MissingDependencies parent object is changed from InvalidState to
InvariantViolation, which is more appropriate.

Unused ClosedException is dropped.

Breaking change: any client code that used renamed exceptions,
ClosedException or relied on catching MissingDependencies as
InvariantViolationException is affected.

Change-Id: I649b7760d382ccb6df333bdffd667ba6b67a431e
"}]
commit_message:
Exceptions cleanup

Most TaskFlow exception don't have 'Exception' suffix in their names, so
we drop it from the few that have it, for sake of consistency and more
concise and expressive code.

MissingDependencies parent object is changed from InvalidState to
InvariantViolation, which is more appropriate.

Unused ClosedException is dropped.

Breaking change: any client code that used renamed exceptions,
ClosedException or relied on catching MissingDependencies as
InvariantViolationException is affected.

Change-Id: I649b7760d382ccb6df333bdffd667ba6b67a431e

commit_message:
rubocop compliance

all cops now pass except for the following
(which are silenced in .rubocop.yml )

* LineLength, MethodLength: not sure if we care about these
* WordArray: I prefer [] vs %w{} for readability.

Conflicts:
	metadata.rb
	recipes/common.rb
	recipes/openvswitch.rb
	spec/openvswitch_spec.rb

Change-Id: I92996b5db9f292e9ba93c7619ca727ffa92ddd71

commit_message:
Implement Rubocop

Per the blueprint, finish implementing rubocop across the entire
cookbook, remove tailor references, and update rubocop dependency.

- Remove .tailor file
- Update Rubocop Dependency >= 0.16.0
- Update Chef Dependency to 11.8
- Add .rubocop.yml files to resources/providers
- Add resources/providers to Strainerfile
- Update all files necessary to pass rubocop

Change-Id: Icc4804b3e2a55cf6656b2e6077e36f04d959b9ef
Implements: blueprint rubocop-for-image

Add API binding options

Ceilometer is able to bind API server to both an IP address and a port.
This patch aims to add support for both configuration flags.

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit f8eea90cd9f1652ba927bfcc9bf8234af8983c11)

subject: Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 14:41:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': "Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184
(cherry picked from commit 6931ad585b0392bdd118e6a40258caa5887ffd9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184
(cherry picked from commit 6931ad585b0392bdd118e6a40258caa5887ffd9d)

commit_message:
Replace oslo.uuidutils module with trove.utils

Oslo is removing uuidutils during the icehouse cycle.
Consequently we need to remove all references to uuidutils, and
replace them with the corresponding function from trove.utils.

Change-Id: Idd4b25e98624dfb6a25e275cac44a54324f50449
Closes-bug: 1253497

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-01-13 12:58:04.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql/service.py', 'trove/instance/models.py', 'trove/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils

Reasons:
- instance.models._create_resources is still uses uuid as root_password.
- generate_random_password needs to be used in a diferent module, so it
  is a candidate to be moved to trove.common.utils, so that any
  new change could be made at one place only, affecting all used-cases.

Changes:
- Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils
- Replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid with generate_random_password in
  trove.instance.models._create_resources(password_length).

Change-Id: Ib58bf83b3c052261418907db41ca963768d2e710
Closes-Bug: #1264330
'}]
commit_message:
Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils

Reasons:
- instance.models._create_resources is still uses uuid as root_password.
- generate_random_password needs to be used in a diferent module, so it
  is a candidate to be moved to trove.common.utils, so that any
  new change could be made at one place only, affecting all used-cases.

Changes:
- Relocates generate_random_password to common.utils
- Replaces uuidutils.generate_uuid with generate_random_password in
  trove.instance.models._create_resources(password_length).

Change-Id: Ib58bf83b3c052261418907db41ca963768d2e710
Closes-Bug: #1264330

commit_message:
Fix broken iptables command in cinder

Fixes a broken iptables command from
3f34fc4d287fcd2ed7a1be9e116c85a8d336b19e.

This was causing invalid port/service errors.

Also, fixes an issue where the /var/run/cinder
directory doesn't actually exist.

With both of these fixes the cinder element
actually runs for me.

Change-Id: I236a84ac7c73b0295d4734fac62f94b9722bd512
Closes-bug: 1269143

commit_message:
Replace calls to pyudev with calls to a fake pyudev when not available

When running tox on platforms that do not have pyudev, tox exits with an
error due to the import error.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-January/023268.html

Change-Id: I94de089ea0b661f62dedecd9977379adb56def6b

commit_message:
Improve testing of list_extensions for compute

This commit takes the testing for list_extension from the volumes
extensions client and uses it for the compute testing of
list_extensions. This also fixes a skip decorator to use use
requires_ext instead of calling is_extension_enabled directly.

Change-Id: Id08f39e09df0aea0d3c8f507f421c82ddf32900f

Input and output ids are not part of the Java workflow JSON schema. Including
them, even set to None, causes an error.  In order to maintain backward
compatibility, leave input_id and output_id as required parameters but
do not add them to the job exec data if they are None.

Closes-Bug: #1268695
Change-Id: I8df8cb86094f5d67ca16de7d6dd253af142eca25
'}]
commit_message:
JobExecutionsManager.create() should handle input_id/output_id == None

Input and output ids are not part of the Java workflow JSON schema. Including
them, even set to None, causes an error.  In order to maintain backward
compatibility, leave input_id and output_id as required parameters but
do not add them to the job exec data if they are None.

Closes-Bug: #1268695
Change-Id: I8df8cb86094f5d67ca16de7d6dd253af142eca25

commit_message:
L3 Agent can handle many external networks

With this patch a l3 agent can handle
any networks by setting the neutron
parameter external_network_bridge
and gateway_external_network_id to
empty.

Related-Bug: #1194350

commit_message:
Added cache for image_username

This change removes roundtrip to nova for each remote() call.

It is also important for long provision operations because auth
token could expire during cluster provisioning timeframe.

Introduced nodegroup.image_username field with information about
username used.

Change-Id: I00f318a9bf34b221c8ccf7a4f22e9ed3fd91e806

commit_message:
Fix WADL validation errors

The dbaas.wadl file contains many text blocks which need to be
wrapped in <para> tags. Newer versions of clouddocs-maven-plugin
validate these blocks, resulting in docs build errors until they are
fixed.

Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ia5733a7fb1c0827a7cec500e1ee51a896a0e7754

subject: checking for metaclass to be Python 3.x compatible
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 6722, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo(gcb)', 'email': 'guochbo@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'guochbo'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7203, 'name': 'yuuichi fujioka', 'email': 'fujioka.yuuichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'FujiokaYuuichi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-12-18 02:34:05.000000000', 'files': ['hacking/core.py', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'checking for metaclass to be Python 3.x compatible

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.(H236)

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I24a00d9e59ffdd9abf4ccf3919737bdb079819eb
Related-Bug: #1236648
'}]
commit_message:
checking for metaclass to be Python 3.x compatible

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.(H236)

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I24a00d9e59ffdd9abf4ccf3919737bdb079819eb
Related-Bug: #1236648

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-01-08 15:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/aggregates.py', 'etc/nova/policy.json', 'nova/tests/fake_policy.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_aggregates.py'], 'message': "Add finer granularity to host aggregate APIs

This change provides the ability to set finer permission rules around
the host aggregate APIs. Prior to this change, all operations assumed
that the same permissions were necessary. However, it's very possible
that an OpenStack administrator may want to have varying sets of
permissions for operations across the standard CRUD operations.  This
change is only applicable to the v3 APIs as v2 APIs should remain
backwards compatible.

Also included is a change to fake_policy.py (since the file was
updated anyway) to make the base aggregate policy require the
'admin_api' rule (i.e., to be consistent with the policy.json file).

Also added the corresponding API test cases.

DocImpact v3 host aggregate APIs require action-level policies
Implements: blueprint aggregate-api-policy

Change-Id: I8a88824bbb41807fad849ad15af4411d3a3dca6e
"}]
commit_message:
Add finer granularity to host aggregate APIs

This change provides the ability to set finer permission rules around
the host aggregate APIs. Prior to this change, all operations assumed
that the same permissions were necessary. However, it's very possible
that an OpenStack administrator may want to have varying sets of
permissions for operations across the standard CRUD operations.  This
change is only applicable to the v3 APIs as v2 APIs should remain
backwards compatible.

Also included is a change to fake_policy.py (since the file was
updated anyway) to make the base aggregate policy require the
'admin_api' rule (i.e., to be consistent with the policy.json file).

Also added the corresponding API test cases.

DocImpact v3 host aggregate APIs require action-level policies
Implements: blueprint aggregate-api-policy

Change-Id: I8a88824bbb41807fad849ad15af4411d3a3dca6e

commit_message:
Remove PostgreSQL dependencies from Barbican.

PostgreSQL is an optional database type for use with Barbican, so there
is no need to include that as a forced dependency on Barbican.

Change-Id: I260ce85475b83079d173ad57f3e755efd1841483

commit_message:
Isolated network support

This patch aims to enable support for both:
- isolated metadata which enable metadata support on isolated networks.
- metadata networks which allows for serving metadata requests coming
  from a dedicated metadata access network

Change-Id: I0e892c4183bd2bf1910b9b6758c1759475053529
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
removing run_tests.sh

run_tests.sh is a shell script that builds a virtualenv, runs
setup.py, and executes tests.  This file is not used by the
build process or by developers.  Tox is being used for this
functionality.

Change-Id: Ib86cdc98052154b9f5b40f09f9786a827a754792

is not needed anymore. This patch removes it.

subject: Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 14:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['Makefile'], 'message': "Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe

We include a comment to explain why nova-compute-instance.yaml is
included in the prerequisite list for overcloud.yaml, but this comment
gets echoed by make before it executes the recipe using a shell.

  $> make overcloud.yaml
  # overcloud-source.yaml [..] won't work here because [..]
  # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py
  python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py overcloud-source.yaml [..]
  mv overcloud.yaml.tmp overcloud.yaml

Instead, maintain a list of files included by overcloud.yaml in a
variable and put a comment above that.

Change-Id: I1af69fbb33e1833170f086aec9b54c5c4e57138f
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid echoing comment from makefile recipe

We include a comment to explain why nova-compute-instance.yaml is
included in the prerequisite list for overcloud.yaml, but this comment
gets echoed by make before it executes the recipe using a shell.

  $> make overcloud.yaml
  # overcloud-source.yaml [..] won't work here because [..]
  # a prerequisite but don't want to pass it into merge.py
  python ./tripleo_heat_merge/merge.py overcloud-source.yaml [..]
  mv overcloud.yaml.tmp overcloud.yaml

Instead, maintain a list of files included by overcloud.yaml in a
variable and put a comment above that.

Change-Id: I1af69fbb33e1833170f086aec9b54c5c4e57138f

commit_message:
Step 1 refactoring Mistral engines

 * Action definition was combined in actions module
 * workflow from both single and scalable engines were deleted
 * task from single engine was deleted
 * unit test 'test_workflow' was deleted due to deleting workflow
 * minor fixes to single engine

 Next step will be extracting and combining common parts
 of scalable and single engine.

Change-Id: I15fbbb7f9d5e453c17625423eeb1bf841a19db18

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-01-14 13:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-apply-config/etc/cinder/cinder.conf', 'elements/cinder-volume/README.md', 'elements/cinder-api/README.md', 'elements/cinder-volume/install.d/74-cinder-volume', 'elements/cinder/README.md', 'elements/cinder-volume/element-deps', 'elements/cinder/pre-install.d/00-cinder-disable-requiretty', 'elements/cinder-api/element-deps', 'elements/cinder-volume/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/74-cinder-volume', 'elements/cinder/install.d/72-cinder', 'elements/cinder-api/install.d/73-cinder-api', 'elements/cinder-api/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/73-cinder-api', 'elements/cinder/os-refresh-config/pre-configure.d/97-cinder-fedora-iptables'], 'message': "Updates cinder element

The previous cinder element was lacking a notty file and didn't
open the required ports in iptables.  This patch also allows a
developer to install the minimum required components for a
single cinder instance or (n) cinder-volume nodes.

This update results in 3 elements
cinder        : common cinder element
cinder-api    : installs the cinder api and scheduler
cinder-volume : installs the cinder volume service

Change-Id: I1ed9f67848be5716135085b6eaebc1f381ad83f9
"}]
commit_message:
Updates cinder element

The previous cinder element was lacking a notty file and didn't
open the required ports in iptables.  This patch also allows a
developer to install the minimum required components for a
single cinder instance or (n) cinder-volume nodes.

This update results in 3 elements
cinder        : common cinder element
cinder-api    : installs the cinder api and scheduler
cinder-volume : installs the cinder volume service

Change-Id: I1ed9f67848be5716135085b6eaebc1f381ad83f9

subject: Remove redundant user ownership declaration and ensure spec test coherency
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-09 16:48:04.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/swift_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Remove redundant user ownership declaration and ensure spec test coherency

swift is already set as a owner for File[] resources. This is a
simple cleanup that removes a redundant user declaration. The spec
tests did not verify that default File[] values were applied to
/var/lib/swift.

Change-Id: I608ef39ca8bbf78ca8029a65979db659184baa3f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant user ownership declaration and ensure spec test coherency

swift is already set as a owner for File[] resources. This is a
simple cleanup that removes a redundant user declaration. The spec
tests did not verify that default File[] values were applied to
/var/lib/swift.

Change-Id: I608ef39ca8bbf78ca8029a65979db659184baa3f

Since https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/e997f8b06ecd4ed0a13c557d621db69eb68f2f3d

commit_message:
L3 schedulers support

Icehouse brings new schedulers for virtual routing.
This patch aims to:
- add router_scheduler_driver flag support
- document which schedulers we could use

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-21 17:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Support network_device_mtu of nova managed interfaces

network_device_mtu configure the MTU for nova managed network interfaces.
By default no specific network_device_mtu configuration is set. The
interface defaults will be used as they got created.

This options allows configuration of Jumbo Frame usage.

Change-Id: Ia391f3daa788c780c4492071a480052b4ef4cc37
'}]
commit_message:
Support network_device_mtu of nova managed interfaces

network_device_mtu configure the MTU for nova managed network interfaces.
By default no specific network_device_mtu configuration is set. The
interface defaults will be used as they got created.

This options allows configuration of Jumbo Frame usage.

Change-Id: Ia391f3daa788c780c4492071a480052b4ef4cc37

commit_message:
Sync glossary and firstterm

Ensure that for each firstterm, we have a proper entry in the glossary:
* Use <firstterm baseform="xxx"> if the first term is spelled differently
  than the glossary entry.
* Remove some firstterm markups where no entry is in the glossary
  and adding one not useful.

Change-Id: Id7093a53f9d466db774b548749116288425af581

commit_message:
Add test fail when Keystone not available

Implemented exception handling upon Keystone client
initialization. Added method that verifies if clients
have initialized and fails if they didn`t. Added
invocation of this method to setUp classes.

Change-Id: I9437b971cc54da144f12d0368b6181d004f82604
Closes-bug: 1267946

commit_message:
Part 1 of FloatingIP PTR record functionality

    This is part 1 - event handling in sink is Part 2 + Others.

    * Central methods update_floatingip, get_floatingip, list_floatingip
    * API according to
    * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Designate/Blueprints/Reverse
    * Put network functionanlity into a pluggable api class (In case we want
    * more)

    blueprint floating-ip-ptrs

    Change-Id: Ic9194e5bcfc8d25126b9e84652144f58cddcccfe

Change-Id: Ib69f17ff8f2d888cf15f2cab7f46404cd201ae7e

subject: Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 22:16:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': "Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184
"}]
commit_message:
Removed packages installed as dependencies by OVS plug-in agent

I removed packages installed as dependencies by the Open vSwitch
plug-in agent package on Ubuntu and Debian. For example, the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package automatically installs
the openvswitch-switch package, so the instructions shouldn't
specifically call out installing the latter.

Also, on the controller node which doesn't need to run the OVS
plug-in agent but still needs to know about the configured plug-in,
I changed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent package to the
neutron-plugin-openvswitch package.

Change-Id: I13a50854149109a10155d0b6b05307a663563438
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1264184

subject: Removed package providing 'neutron-server' from network node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 21:21:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-install.xml'], 'message': "Removed package providing 'neutron-server' from network node

While fixing another bug, I noticed that the instructions for RHEL and
SUSE install a metapackage providing 'neutron-server', but do not
configure it to start on boot. In comparison, the Ubuntu instructions
install the specific package providing 'neutron-server' and
automatically configure it to start on boot.

I originally intended to patch this issue by providing instructions
for disabling 'neutron-server' in Upstart, but upon further
investigation, determined that 'neutron-server' does not need to run
on the network node, nor do any of the other packages
(neutron-l3-agent and neutron-dhcp-agent) depend on the neutron-server
package. So, this patch removes the neutron-server package from the
Ubuntu instructions and from the list of services to restart on all
distributions. I also removed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent
package from the Ubuntu instructions since we shouldn't cover specific
plug-ins in this section.

Change-Id: I5c08a56b37d8aef656826fc1b644efc799aa51a7
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1265833
"}]
commit_message:
Removed package providing 'neutron-server' from network node

While fixing another bug, I noticed that the instructions for RHEL and
SUSE install a metapackage providing 'neutron-server', but do not
configure it to start on boot. In comparison, the Ubuntu instructions
install the specific package providing 'neutron-server' and
automatically configure it to start on boot.

I originally intended to patch this issue by providing instructions
for disabling 'neutron-server' in Upstart, but upon further
investigation, determined that 'neutron-server' does not need to run
on the network node, nor do any of the other packages
(neutron-l3-agent and neutron-dhcp-agent) depend on the neutron-server
package. So, this patch removes the neutron-server package from the
Ubuntu instructions and from the list of services to restart on all
distributions. I also removed the neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent
package from the Ubuntu instructions since we shouldn't cover specific
plug-ins in this section.

Change-Id: I5c08a56b37d8aef656826fc1b644efc799aa51a7
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1265833

userd variables in project anymore.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-14 09:01:54.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_strutils.py', 'openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'message': 'strutils bool_from_string, allow specified default

In certain cases, we may want to return true by default, e.g see

Change-Id: I6c86b03125f263cf4843b4cf1addf9e9812f53a8

commit_message:
strutils bool_from_string, allow specified default

In certain cases, we may want to return true by default, e.g see
the discussion in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65725/, so provide
a "default" argument which can be used to override the existing default
False response.

Change-Id: I6c86b03125f263cf4843b4cf1addf9e9812f53a8

subject: Ensure Flask uses our JSON Encoder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-13 14:58:05.000000000', 'files': ['designate/api/__init__.py', 'designate/api/v1/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Ensure Flask uses our JSON Encoder

Since the upgrade to Flask 0.10, we've not been using the correct
JSONEncoder. Up until today, we this was "not a problem", as
python-keystoneclient depended on simplejson, which provided the
necessary features.

python-keystoneclient 0.4.2 was released today, causing the issue
to finally surface.

Change-Id: Idc0e8f03608c80e097db2ea48b30f2bc0b8dbe5d
Closes-Bug: 1268607
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure Flask uses our JSON Encoder

Since the upgrade to Flask 0.10, we've not been using the correct
JSONEncoder. Up until today, we this was "not a problem", as
python-keystoneclient depended on simplejson, which provided the
necessary features.

python-keystoneclient 0.4.2 was released today, causing the issue
to finally surface.

Change-Id: Idc0e8f03608c80e097db2ea48b30f2bc0b8dbe5d
Closes-Bug: 1268607

commit_message:
Update neutron options for icehouse

Also fixed up some duplicate config options due to a bug in autohelp.py.
While working through duplication options, I believe I encountered some
that weren't being output, but I'd rather spend the time fixing the tool
than manually adding those.

Change-Id: I60eb035b97d354bc57168421facafd895ace2a10

commit_message:
Add a fake ZooKeeper driver

This patch add a new driver which mimic a Kazoo client
without the need to use a real zookeeper server.

The dependency Zake (written by Joshua Harlow:harlowja@gmail.com)
has been added which provides the Kazoo API.

Change-Id: I53ca9ac972d6e2dca2f9e04b6187ee0545813e74

commit_message:
Add new modprobe-blacklist element.

This element can be used to provide a custom list
of modules via DIB_MODPROBE_BLACKLIST which
will be disabled via modprobe.d/blacklist.conf.

I'm using this to disable network adapters on the
Red Hat TripleO rack where the devices can't be
explicitly disabled via the BIOS.

Change-Id: I8a0a8ee05fa62628434d7f6422577dbf5cdd7a2e

subject: Add package support to source-repositories
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-13 13:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/source-repositories/README.md', 'elements/source-repositories/extra-data.d/98-source-repositories'], 'message': 'Add package support to source-repositories

Adds a new "package" type to source-repositories. When the package type
is specified in an origin-repository-* file the package name and type
"package" need to be specified like so:

nova package

The existing map-packages mechanism can be used to map the specified
package name to the actual distribution package names.  The
pre-configured package repositories on the image will be used to install
the packages during the install.d phase of the image build.

If the repo type is package, an environment.d hook script is updated
with an environment variable which is sourced by dib-run-parts. This is
so that other hooks, particularly in install.d, will know what repo type
was used and can make the correct decision about doing a source install
or not.

Change-Id: Ief4e524664cd32d2087aeb3b1766f05e017de91e
'}]
commit_message:
Add package support to source-repositories

Adds a new "package" type to source-repositories. When the package type
is specified in an origin-repository-* file the package name and type
"package" need to be specified like so:

nova package

The existing map-packages mechanism can be used to map the specified
package name to the actual distribution package names.  The
pre-configured package repositories on the image will be used to install
the packages during the install.d phase of the image build.

If the repo type is package, an environment.d hook script is updated
with an environment variable which is sourced by dib-run-parts. This is
so that other hooks, particularly in install.d, will know what repo type
was used and can make the correct decision about doing a source install
or not.

Change-Id: Ief4e524664cd32d2087aeb3b1766f05e017de91e

commit_message:
Use dynamic catalog for keystone on SUSE

Keystone uses dynamic catalog by default, which supports management
commands. Meanwhile, current static catalog default_catalog.templates
is lack of ceilometer endpoints.

This patch simply removes the catalog configure step to use default
setting.

Change-Id: Ie852c0dc4dc03b7120116dd25b10ee58a5d91e3e
Closes-Bug: #1267322
(cherry picked from commit b3ae3222b34f7282f875658387228de650f81d77)

commit_message:
Allow passing extra args to JobExecutionsManager.create()

Java job types require additional parameters beyond cluster_id and
configs.  Add an optional dictionary and an update call to allow
for additional key/value settings.

Closes-Bug: #1268695

Change-Id: I995e648a939063170d1a2ac7040493351fb67f74

commit_message:
Add a wait condition to undercloud stack

Using of Heat wait conditions allows us to reliably reason when a
stack creation is complete (as the completion handle is triggered
when os-refresh-config completes).

Change-Id: I89725143532177a0b4aea23c1c31bc7737da0896

commit_message:
Add check_and_fence method and tests for nailgun agent:NodeAgent

To run unit tests use:
rspec ./bin/agent_spec.rb --color --format documentation

Make sure you have:
ruby 1.9.3p429 / 1.8.7p371
rspec 2.14.7
---------------------
httpclient (2.3.4.1)
json (1.8.1)
logger (1.2.8)
ohai (6.20.0)
rethtool (0.0.3)

Implements: blueprint fencing-in-nailgun-agent

Change-Id: Ic7d9d38a65514a89aa1581109757fb1ed8a6702c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Prevent caller from specifying id during PciDevice.create()

The patch is to remove id when it was set before creating a PCI device
in objects.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects.

Change-Id: Idd6d40e88f7251307504c945453281656eebb073

subject: Validate further XML files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-14 07:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['os_doc_tools/doctest.py', 'os_doc_tools/resources/README.txt', 'os_doc_tools/resources/wadl.xsd', 'os_doc_tools/resources/xml.xsd'], 'message': 'Validate further XML files

Do simple XML validation of .xsd, .xsl, .xjb files - just for well-formed XML,
no schema validation yet.

Fix a bug introduced with version 0.2 that we did not use a schema
for .wadl files. Testing this, there were too many errors with the RelaxNG
validation, so use XMLSchema as recommend by David Cramer.

Added XMLSchema files for local parsing.

Change-Id: I589f00a2e3dc46b6b3ba5e965fa9d4eba6d1a295
'}]
commit_message:
Validate further XML files

Do simple XML validation of .xsd, .xsl, .xjb files - just for well-formed XML,
no schema validation yet.

Fix a bug introduced with version 0.2 that we did not use a schema
for .wadl files. Testing this, there were too many errors with the RelaxNG
validation, so use XMLSchema as recommend by David Cramer.

Added XMLSchema files for local parsing.

Change-Id: I589f00a2e3dc46b6b3ba5e965fa9d4eba6d1a295
